loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a 27-year-old hardworking business man. For the last three years, he has been managing a retail shop and also supplying bread to earn a living. He has employed two people to help him to manage the business. In the next 5 years, he wants to manage a supermarket.  John is requesting a loan of 100,000 Kenyan shillings to buy more bread for resale.

loans.use: buy bread

loans.name: Zachary

texts.en: Zachary has been managing a general store for the last three years to make a living. Previously, he was running a boutique. In the next 5 years, he wants to open a supermarket. He is requesting a loan of 30,000 Kenya shillings to buy sugar, cooking fat, and soap for resale. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has been able to boost his business with his previous loan.

loans.use: To buy sugar, cooking fat, and soap

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en: Samwel is married and blessed with two children. For the last nine years, he has been managing an electrical goods shop to support his family. He also sells clothes to earn extra income. He has employed one person to help him manage the business. In the next 5 years, he wants to expand his business. He is requesting a loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy carbon brushes and starters for resale. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has been able to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To buy carbon brushes and starters

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a resident of Nkubu in Central Kenya.  He is married and has 2 children, aged 12 and 6.  He is 51 years old.  

Francis has been in farming for 11 years, producing and selling potatoes, cabbages and milk to the local market.  He has requested a loan of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to construct a zero grazing unit for his dairy cows and sheep.  He says this will help him secure feeds for his animals and increase his income with better feeding. He adds that his focus is to buy more land to expand his farming business and educate his children.  He laments the high costs of farm inputs and common animal diseases.

loans.use: to construct a zero grazing unit

loans.name: Mwita

texts.en: Mwita is married and blessed with one child.  For the past three years, he has been operating a motorbike transport business to earn a living. He has retained his business because of his hard work and determination.  In the next 5 years, he wants to buy a piece of land. Since he decided to join Faulu Kenya, Mwita has been able to access loan to boost his business. With this loan for 80,000 Kenyan shillings, he wants to buy a motorbike.

loans.use: buy a motorbike

loans.name: Teressa

texts.en:
Teressa is 30 years old.  She is a married woman with one child who is not in school.  She has a business selling sodas in South Sudan and has been in this business for five years.

Teressa requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to enable her to purchase sodas to  resell.  She says that she will use the extra income from this loan to build a permanent house in the future.

loans.use: buy soft drinks

loans.name: Denis

texts.en:
Denis is a 33-year-old hardworking business man. He is married and blessed with two children. For the last seven years, he has been selling shoes to make a living. He also runs a green grocer to earn extra income.  Denis has employed three people to help him in the business. In the next 5 years, he wants to become more financially stable. 

Denis is requesting a loan of 80,000 Kenyan shillings to buy tomatoes, onions and cabbages for resale. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has been able to boost his business with the previous loan.

loans.use: To buy tomatoes, onions and cabbages

loans.name: Carolina

texts.es: Carolina de 47 años, es una mujer trabajadora que es vendedora de perfumes. Inicio cuando su Mama murió ya que tenía que hacerse cargo de su familia pues todavía tiene 3 hijos bajo su cargo. El objetivo del crédito es para la compra de perfumes, cremas, body, tratamientos, lápiz labial, polvos, entre otros. Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso quiere mejorar sus ingresos con el préstamo ya que lo utilizara para comprar la materia prima necesaria.
texts.en: Carolina is a 47 year old hardworking woman who sells perfumes. She began working after her mother passed away since she then had to be in charge of the 3 children in her family. The loan will be used to buy perfumes, body creams, treatments, lip liners, powders, as well as other products.  She has many aspirations for her business so she wants to increase profits by using the loan to stock up on more merchandise to sell.

loans.use: buy perfumes, body creams, treatments, lip liners, powders, as well as other products.

loans.name: Silvio Jose

texts.es: Silvio tiene 36 años, el se destaca por ser un hombre con muchas responsabilidades que cumplir, por ello se despierta desde muy temprano para empezar a comprar sus productos. Dicho negocio funciona desde hace 19 años, y desde entonces se dedica a ello,  los platillos que ofrece son deliciosos y los disfruta. Su puesto de ventas se sitúa en un lugar muy concurrido por su clienta. Este crédito ser realizara con el fin de comprar granos básicos, bolsas, platos desechable, verduras, frutas, carnes y pollos.
texts.en: Silvio is 36 years old. He stands out as a man with a lot of responsibilities. That is why he gets up very early to start to buy his products. He has had his business for 19 years. The dishes he offers are delicious and he enjoys them. His point of sales is located in a place frequented by a lot of customers. This loan will be taken out in order to buy basic grains, bags, disposable plates, vegetables, fruit, meat and chicken.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, disposable plates, vegetables, fruit, meat and chicken.

loans.name: Gukoranikare Group

texts.fr:
Jean fait partie du groupe Gukoranikare. Le nom du groupe signifie “travailler tôt “. Il a 61 ans et il est marié avec 6 enfants de 10 à 21 ans, dont 6 scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est 4 ans de primaire. 

Jean est cultivateur de riz. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques pour son agriculture de riz.

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’utiliser une semence sélectionnée de riz. Dans les prochaines années, Jean voudrait être fournisseur de riz dans sa région. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’éduquer et soigner des enfants.
texts.en:
Jean is a member of Gukoranikare Group, which means "working early". He is 61 years old, married and the father of six children, aged 10 to 21, all attending school. He attended elementary school until fourth grade.

Jean is a rice farmer. This is his first loan cycle with the microfinance institution ACB. He will use his loan to buy chemical fertilizer for his rice crop.

His growth strategy for his business consists in using specially selected rice seeds. In the years to come Jean would like to become a known rice supplier in his region. He will use his profit to provide his children with education and healthcare.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizer for his rice crop.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
This is 42-year-old Marie.  She is married and has 3 children, aged 7, 5 and 2. She has 5 additional dependents who are her relatives from the village.  

In 1991, Marie established her provisions and imported foodstuff business. She began her business because she wants to be self-reliant and self-employed.  Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,300,000 every month from this business. 

Marie would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000.   She has already received and successfully repaid 3 loans and now requires a new loan in order to buy more imported foodstuff for her business. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. 

In the future, Marie plans to transform her business into a shop to help her provide for her children's education and medical bills. Her products are daily consumables and she has a lot of customers because of the nature of her business. She thanks you for your support

loans.use: buy imported foodstuff

loans.name: Kerin Fernando

texts.es:
Kerin, es soltero vive con su madre, él se dedica a vender sorbetes, paletas y sorbeletas,en el centro de la ciudad, de lunes a sábado, no tiene un horario establecido.
El préstamo lo necesita para comprar producto como, paletas, sorbetes, vasitos, de esa forma tendrá surtido el negocio, para atender la demanda de los clientes.
El propósito de Kerin es mantener su negocio  y de esa forma ayudarle  a su madre para los gastos de la casa.
texts.en:
Kerin is single and lives with his mother. He sells sorbets, popsicles, and ice cream bars in the center of town. He sells Mondays through Saturdays and has no set schedule.

He needs the loan to buy products such as popsicles, sorbets, and cups. This will stock his business so he can serve his customers. Kerin's objective is to maintain his business and thus help his mother with the household expenses.

loans.use: Compra de paletas, sorbetes, vasitos.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
This is Regina, 41, resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Juan, an overseas Filipino worker, and is the mother to their three children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income to cover their everyday expenses.

Regina operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Aside from this, she also does some direct selling. Her store is adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She makes a minimum of PHP 450 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 13,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Regina hopes to be able to expand soon and dreams to be able to give her children a high-quality education through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Hilda Consuelo

texts.es:
Hilda, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo, debido a la necesidad de introducir los servicios básicos del hogar, utilizando los fondos en el pago de la instalación de energía eléctrica.
El préstamo anterior le sirvió para fortalecer el negocio y ofrecer a los clientes más productos, así como fue una gran ayuda para mantener a la clientela y mejorar las ventas.
texts.en:
Hilda has decided to ask for a new loan in order to have electricity installed at her home. The funds from this loan will be used to pay for the installation of electricity.

Her previous loan helped her grow her business and she was able to offer her customers more products, and this was a big help keeping her clients and increasing her sales.

loans.use: to pay for the installation of electricity at her home

loans.name: Classe Source De Vie Plus Group

texts.en:
Pedro is the leader of the community bank named “Classe Source de Vie Plus” which is composed of 36 microentrepreneurs. These members are united in the same goal: to grow their businesses by loans received from Kiva through IMF HOPE DRC. 

Pedro is 45 years old. His main activity is to sell soft drinks. He buys crates of soft drinks and resells them at a profit. He sells his products daily in his area.

Pedro started his business in 2002. He is very excited to be one of the IMF HOPE DRC’s clients. His next loan will allow him to buy crates of soft drinks and resell them at a profit. Pedro makes a profit of about US$18 per day. The aims of this loan are mainly for strengthening the working capital of his business and expanding in the near future to a facility to keep soft drinks for reselling. Pedro is married and takes care of two nephews.

loans.use: to buy crates of soft drinks for reselling at a profit

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Rosa Angela

texts.es:
Rosa de 32 años de edad, vive en una zona suburbana de Guayaquil llamada “isla trinitaria”. Es una mujer trabajadora que tiene muchas aspiraciones de crecimiento de su negocio. Por eso quiere seguir adelante en su pequeña tienda en donde vende  víveres de primera necesidad como arroz, bebidas, aceites, entre otros.

Desea continuar trabajando con la ayuda de su esposo que es vendedor ambulante. Tiene 3 hijos de 18, 15, 13, solo uno de ellos estudia que es el que tiene 13 años.

Su sueño es incrementar su negocio y desea implementar más productos en su tienda y darles el estudio a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Rosa is 32 years old and lives in a suburb of Guayaquil called Isla Trinitaria (Trinity Island). She is a hard working woman who has many dreams of increasing her business. This is why she wants to move forward in her little store where she sells staples such as rice, drinks, oils and other items.

She wants to continue working with the help of her husband who is a salesman. They have 3 children who are 18, 15, and 13 years old. Only the 13 year old is in school.

Her dream is to increase her business and she wants to increase the amount of goods she has in her store in order to give her children the opportunity to study.

loans.use: to buy drinks, rice, and oils

loans.name: Yekaterina

texts.ru:
Екатерина старше 65 лет. Она живет и работает в курортном городе Бердянске. Она вдова. Екатерина занимается торговлей женской обуви и одежды, а также головных уборов. С тех пор как Екатерина открыла свою торговую точку, она постоянно стремилась ее развивать и пополняла ассортимент товара. Несмотря на свой преклонный возраст, Екатерина отличается трудоспособностью, физически здорова, постоянно торгует вот уже 15 лет. На данный момент ее оборотный капитал составляет 40 000 гривен. 

Екатерина планирует использовать кредит в 12 000 гривен для того, чтобы увеличить ассортимент товара и удачно его реализовать по ценам ниже обычных рыночных на сегодняшний момент. Прошлой весной Екатерина Юрьевна сделала капитальный ремонт в своем доме, установила кондиционер, приобрела компьютер для внука, поклеила обои в доме, отреставрировала наружную часть западной стороны дома.

Пометка: история на РУССКОМ языке
texts.en: Yekaterina is older than 65 years old.  She lives and works in the resort town of Berdyansk.  She is a widow.  Yekaterina is involved in sales of women's shoes and clothing and also hats.  Since Yekaterina opened her retail outlet, she has always tried to grow and expand the merchandise assortment.  Despite her age, Yekaterina stands out for her hard work; she is physically healthy and has been working in this business consistently for 15 years.  Currently, her revolving capital amounts to 40,000 hryvnia.  Yekaterina plans to use the 12,000 hryvnia loan to expand the merchandise assortment and successfully sell it at prices lower than usual current market prices.  Last spring, Yekaterina Yur'evna made major repairs to her house, installed an air conditioner, bought a computer for her grandson, replaced wallpaper in her home and repaired an outer west-facing side of her house.

loans.use: to expand merchandise assortment

loans.name: Martha Gregoria

texts.es:
Martha de 29 años. Vive en una zona periurbana llamada el “fortín”. Es una mujer muy empeñosa en su trabajo se destaca diariamente en lo que hace, ella tiene un comedor que inicio hace un año. Ya que ella se di cuenta que tenía el talento para la cocina.

La dificultad de ella es la delincuencia y la competencia. Ella solicita este préstamo para agrandar su negocio y comprar mercadería como: platos, cucharas, bebidas, etc.

Su sueño es terminar su casa de cemento, que su negocio este en un local comercial y que sus hijos puedan terminar la carrera escolar.
texts.en:
Martha is 29 years old and lives in a peri-urban area called 'El Fortín'.  She is a woman who is very committed to her work.  She distinguishes herself every day in what she does.  Martha has an eatery that she opened a year ago as she realized that she had a talent for cooking.

The difficulties that Martha faces are crime and competition.  She is requesting this loan to expand her business and to buy merchandise such as plates, spoons, drinks, etc.

Martha's dreams are to finish building her home from cement, for her business to be located in commercial premises and for her children to finish their education.

loans.use: to buy plates, a blender and glasses

loans.name: Margueritte

texts.en: Margueritte is 49 years old and married to a businessman. She has 5 children, aged 20 – 29. She owns a bar which she has been running for 20 years. Margueritte would like a loan to increase her inventory at the bar. She will use the profits to renovate the house and create a savings for her future.

loans.use: To buy more beers for sale

loans.name: Olive

texts.en: Olive is married to a businessman. She has 7 children who are between 6 months and 18 years old. Four of them attend school. Olive is aged 38. She sells vegetables and has spent 5 years in this business. Olive is requesting this loan to buy more vegetables for sale. She will make savings and pay school fees from the profits that she hopes to make from the business. She would like to have a expanded her business to the scale of 10 million RWF of capital.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables for sale

loans.name: Farijika Group

texts.fr: La cliente Batasema, leader du groupe d’affaire «Farijika », est  entrepreneur, âgée de 48  ans, mariée, mère de 10 jeunes enfants. Son mari est un chauffeur. Elle est  vendeuse de pagnes (habits femmes). Elle installe ses marchandises dans une boutique au centre commercial Birere. Il y a 12 ans révolus qu’elle exerce ces petites activités génératrices de revenus de ce genre. Cependant, elle vient de réaliser  18 cycles avec le crédit de Hekima. Son premier capital fut constitué par  son mari. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner avec  25 pièces (pagnes)  à  marchander.  En plus, elle souhaite  voir ses enfants grandir confortablement, accroitre son entreprise et construire confortablement une maison.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique.
texts.en: Batasema, the leader of the Farijika business group, is an entrepreneur, aged 48, married and the mother of ten young children. Her husband is a driver. Batasema sells pagnes (colorful West African cloth for ladies' wear). She has her store in the commercial quarters of Birere. She has earned her living by this activity for the past 12 years. So far she has been granted 18 loan cycles by the microfinance institution Hekima. Her husband gave her some start-up money. Batasema will use her new loan to buy 25 units of pagnes for resale. She wants to see her children grow up in comfort, expand her business and build a comfortable house. Batasema thanks Hekima for their efforts in favor of poor women excluded from the classical banking system.

loans.use: to buy 25 units of pagnes.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Linda Azucena

texts.es:
Linda de 28 años, una mujer muy trabajadora que se desempeña por lo que hace.
Ella inicio su negocio debido a que el sector donde vive no existía ninguna papelería, entonces ella se decidió poner este negocio.

Trabaja con la ayuda de su mama, ya que su mama le ayuda a controlar sus niños mientras ella trabaja.
La dificultad de ella es la delincuencia y el lugar donde alquila el local. El sueño de ella es tener su propio su local.

Ella solicita el préstamo para invertir en cuadernos, papeleria y asi agrandar su negocio.
texts.en:
Linda is 28 years old.  She is a very hard-working woman who does her work well.  She opened her business because, in the area where she lives, there wasn't a stationery store.   She decided, therefore, to set up this kind of business.  

Linda works with the help of her mom as her mom helps her to look after her children while she is working.  The difficulties that she faces are crime and the place where she rents her premises.  Her dream is to own her own premises.

Linda is requesting this loan to invest in composition books and stationery supplies, so that she can expand her business.

loans.use: to buy composition books, erasers and scissors

loans.name: Abesamihigo/ Nybshnj Group

texts.fr:
Private fait partie du groupe Abesamihigo. Le nom du groupe signifie « performers ». Il a 64 ans et il est marié avec 7 enfants de 14 à 42 ans, dont 3 scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est 6 ans de primaire. 

Private est cultivateur de riz. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques pour son agriculture de riz.

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est l’utilisation d’engrais chimiques. Dans les prochaines années, Private voudrait être vendeur de riz dans son district. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’éduquer et soigner ses enfants.
texts.en:
Private is part of the group Abesamihigo/Nyabishunju. The group's name means "performers." He is 64 years old and is married with seven children between the ages of 14 and 42, three of whom are in school. His education level is six years of elementary school. 

Private is a rice farmer. This is his first loan cycle with ACB. He will use his loan to buy chemical fertilizers for his rice farming.

His strategy for the growth of his business is the use of chemical fertilizers. In the coming years, Private would like to be the rice salesman in his district. With the profits, he foresees educating and caring for his children.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers for his rice farming

loans.name: Lima Obaye Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Lima Obaye Group in Western Kenya! This  group joined Kiva partner One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.
Alice is the facilitator of the Lima Obaye Group. She takes care of four children at home with her husband. She joined One Acre Fund in order to receive inputs on credit, and grow enough food to ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Alice had a very good maize yield harvesting 13 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Alice was only able to harvest 4 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.
With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Alice and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.
With income from maize sales, Alice will pay school fees and invest in home or business assets (perhaps a dairy cow).
In 2012, the members of Lima Obaye Group will each plant  between 0.5 and 1.75 acres of maize.
In the picture above, Alice is pictured with her group members.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Sudi Sisters Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Sudi Sisters Group in Western Kenya! This  group joined Kiva partner One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.
Alice is the facilitator of this group. She is the mother of five children. She joined One Acre Fund due to the best prizes offered by the firm, in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds, and to ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Alice had a very good maize yield harvesting 7 bags on 0.5 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Alice was only able to harvest 1.5 bags of maize on 0.5 acre of land.
With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Alice and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.
With income from maize sales, Alice will educate her children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing.
In 2012, the members of Sudi Sisters Group will each plant  between 0.5 and 1 acre of maize.
Alice is pictured with her group members.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Chebukutumi B Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Chebukutumi B Group in Western Kenya! This  group joined Kiva partner One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.
Metrine is the facilitator of the Chebukutumi B Group. She is the mother of five children. She joined One Acre Fund due to the best prices offered by the Fund and in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds to ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, she had an excellent maize yield harvesting 9 bags on 0.5 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Metrine was only able to harvest 3 bags of maize on 0.5 acre of land.
With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Metrine and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.
With income from maize sales, Metrine will save for future use and educate her children.
In 2012, the members of Chebukutumi B Group will each plant  between 0.5 and 1 acre of maize.
In the photograph, Metrine is pictured with her group members.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.en: Jeanne is 31 years old. She is married to a taxi driver. She has 3 children between ages 5 and 11. The two eldest are in school. She has been running  a store for 8 years selling food goods. She would like the loan to expand her business and buy new inventory. The profits will be used to pay school fees and create some savings for her families future.

loans.use: To buy more food to sell in her store

loans.name: Omena Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Omena Group in Western Kenya! This group joined Kiva partner One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.
Eunice is the facilitator of the Omena Group. She takes care of five children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to have additional maize profits and access fertilizer and hybrid seeds. In the recent 2011 season, Eunice had an excellent maize yield harvesting sixteen bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Eunice was only able to harvest four bags of maize on one acre of land.
With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Eunice and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.
With income from maize sales, Eunice will invest in animal rearing and ensure food security.
In 2012, the members of Omena Group will each plant  between half and one acre of maize.
Eunice is pictured together with her group members.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Wakapenduli Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Wakapenduli Group in Western Kenya! Vincent is the facilitator of the Wakapenduli group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Vincent takes care of eight children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Vincent had an excellent maize yield harvesting 19 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, Vincent was only able to harvest six bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Vincent and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With the income from the maize sales, Vincent will educate his children and ensure food security.

In 2012, the members of Wakapenduli group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

Vincent is pictured with his group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Paula Marlene

texts.es:
Paula, vive con su esposo y dos hijos de 7 y 4 años de edad, ella se dedica a un apiario (producción de miel), inicio con este negocio por su padre, lo atiende de lunes a sábado desde hace 3 años.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de medicamentos y azúcar para las abejas, ya que requieren cuidados para que el apiario marche correctamente con buena producción de miel.
La aspiración de Paula es que sus hijos algún día puedan culminar los estudios, sean buenos ciudadanos, y contar con el apoyo siempre de la familia.
texts.en:
Paula lives with her husband and two children aged 7 and 4.  She runs an apiary (producing honey).  She started out in this business through her father.  She works from Monday to Saturday and has been in the business for three years.  She is currently requesting a loan to buy medicines and sugar for her bees as she needs to provide them with some care so that the aviary works correctly and produces a good amount of honey.  

Paula's aspiration is for her children to some day finish their studies, become upstanding citizens and always be able to count on their family's support.

loans.use: to buy medicines and sugar for her bees

loans.name: Nakitang'a Shg Group

texts.en:
Ben is the facilitator of the Nakitang'a SHG group. Ben and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Ben takes care of 10 children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Ben had an excellent maize yield harvesting 15 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Ben was only able to harvest one bag of maize on one acres of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Ben and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With the income from the maize sales, Ben will educate his children and buy food for the family.

In 2012, the members of Nakitang'a SHG group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

In the photograph above, Ben is pictured with his group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Upendo Y/g A Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Upendo Y/G A Group in Western Kenya!  Ronald is the facilitator of the Upendo Y/G A group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Ronald takes care of six children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Ronald had an excellent maize yield harvesting 16 bags on 1 1/2 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Ronald was only able to harvest six bags of maize on 1 1/2 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Ronald and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Ronald will educate his children and have an extension of his house.

In 2012, the members of Upendo Y/G A group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

Ronald is pictured in the photograph with his group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Upendo Y/g B Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Upendo Y/G B Group in Western Kenya!  Peter is the facilitator of the Upendo Y/G B group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Peter is a father of two children. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Peter had a very good maize yield harvesting 12 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Peter was only able to harvest eight bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Peter and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With the income from the maize sales, Peter will save for future use by investing in livestock raising.

In 2012, the members of Upendo Y/G B group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

Peter is pictured with his group members with their Field Officer at the far left in a black/white T-Shirt.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Maema B Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Maema B Group in Western Kenya! Mary is the facilitator of the Maema group. Most members of this group are veteran One Acre Fund farmers, who joined the program in 2009.  They have found the One Acre Fund program to be very beneficial for their farming needs, and are re-enrolling once more for the 2012 season.

Mary is a mother of four children. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access the benefits of high quality farming inputs, delivery services, and farming insurance.  In the recent 2011 season, Mary had a very good maize yield harvesting 10 bags on 1/2 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Mary was only able to harvest three bags of maize on 1/2 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Mary and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With the income from the maize sales, Mary will pay school fees for her children and invest in assets such as livestock.

In 2012, the members of Maema B group will each plant between ½ and two acres of maize.

In the photograph, she is pictured with her group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Sandra Veronica

texts.es:
Sandra, necesita un nuevo crédito para comprar reces (dos novillas) para vender la carne y de esa forma siempre mantener a sus clientes e incrementar en sus ventas. El prestamo anterior lo utilizo para la compra de reces, pues su negocio trata unicamente de la venta de carne, por lo mismo estos prestamos los invierte en el fortalecimiento de él.
El propósito de Sandra es crecer  en su negocio, tener más personas que le ayuden a vender  y poder darles lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
Sandra needs a new loan in order to buy cattle (two new cows) in order to sell the meat and in this way maintain her customer base and increase her sales. 

Her last loan was used to buy cattle, and as her only business is the sale of meat, the loans help her build up her business. 

Sandra’s purpose is to grow her business, to have more people helping her with sales, and to give her family a better life.

loans.use: to buy two head of cattle for the butcher

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: Miguel, solicita un nuevo préstamo para la compra de electrodomésticos, lámparas, focos, y otros artículos que ofrece en el negocio, el desea que con este apoyo pueda fortalecer el negocio en mercadería, ofreciendo a los clientes lo mejor y satisfaciendo las necesidades de ellos. Este es su segundo prestamo, el anterior le ayudo para comprar tambien mercaderia, esta inversion le funciono para mantener a la clientela y poder vender todos los articulos adquiridos, en vista de ello volvera a comprar mercaderia a traves de este prestamo, dandole más vida al negocio.
texts.en:
Miguel is requesting a new loan to buy small electrical appliances, lamps, flashlights and other products that he sells in his business.  He hopes that, with this support, he will be able to strengthen his business with merchandise, offering his customers the best and satisfying their needs.

This is Miguel's second loan.  His previous loan was also used to buy merchandise.  That investment helped him keep his customers and he was able to sell all the goods he bought.  As a result, he will once again buy merchandise with this loan, thereby breathing more life into his business.

loans.use: to buy small electrical appliances, lamps and flashlights

loans.name: Su Santidad Fuerza Y Exito Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Margarita es la presidenta de la Alcancía Comunal “Su Santidad Fuerza y Éxito” el nombre del grupo lo eligieron las socias mezclando el lema “Fuerza y éxito” que representa la unión y las metas que quieren lograr al agruparse, y el nombre de su zona “Su santidad Juan Pablo II”. La Sra. Margarita es conviviente, tiene 4 hijos de los cuales 3 ya trabajan independientemente; y cuenta con una bodega en su casa donde vende todo tipo de productos desde los insumos de primera necesidad hasta regalos y pequeñas cosas típicas de un bazar.
La Sra. Margarita empezó hace 11 años vendiendo gaseosas motivada por la necesidad de cubrir los gastos diarios de su familia. Poco a poco y luchando por no chocar con el capital por alguna eventualidad en su hogar, la Sra. Margarita pudo crecer hasta convertir su pequeño negocio de gaseosas en su propia Bodega. También se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo y sumando todo ese esfuerzo es que ha conseguido comprar un terreno en Ventanilla. Ahora sueña con construir su casa allí y por el momento alquilarlo para generar más ingresos, pero más adelante desea abrir un negocio más. El préstamo actual será utilizado en comprar cerveza y gaseosa porque la temporada de calor ya empezó.
texts.en: Margarita is the president of the communal bank “His Holiness Strength and Success.”  The members named the group by combining the motto “Strength and Success,” which represents the group’s goals, with the area’s name “His holiness Pope John Paul II.”  Margarita lives with her partner and has 4 children, 3 of whom work independently.  She runs a store from her home where she sells all kinds of products, from basic necessities to gifts and little things typical of a bazaar.  Margarita began selling soft drinks 11 years ago, motivated by the need to cover her family’s basic expenses.  Little by little, Margarita’s small business selling soft drinks grew to become her own store.  She also sells beauty products by catalog and, adding up all this effort, she has been able to buy land in Ventanilla.  Now she dreams of building her own home there and renting it out to generate more income, and later she would like to open another business.  The current loan will be used to buy beer and soft drinks because the hot season has begun.

loans.use: buy beer and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Baekissou

texts.fr:
Mme Baekissou est mariée et mère de 02 enfants. Le plus âgé a 23ans et le moins âgé a 20ans. Personne ne va à l’école. Elle a 06 personnes en charge.

Elle vend des pagnes, des boucles d’oreille, des berceaux pour bébé et des produits cosmétiques etc. depuis 07ans. L’argent va servir à l’achat de pagnes, boucles d’oreille et des produits cosmétiques Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Ouagadougou. Ses clients sont les femmes, les hommes.

Elle veut s’acheter 50 pièces de pagnes 30 complets de boucle d’oreille et 30 cartons de produit cosmétiques.

Mme veut utiliser ses bénéfices pour agrandir son hangar. Elle ambitionne ouvrir une grande boutique  de pagnes et de produits de beauté.
texts.en:
Mrs Baekissou is married and the mother of two children: the elder is 23 and the younger 20. None of them attends school. She has six people in her care.

She has been selling pagnes (colorful West African cloth), earrings and cosmetics for seven years. She gets her supplies at the great market in Ouagadougou. Her clientele is made up of women and men. She wants to buy 50 units of pagnes, 30 sets of earrings and 30 boxes of cosmetics.

Mrs Baekissou intends to use her profit to expand her shed. Her ambition is to open a large store for pagnes and beauty products.

loans.use: to buy 50 units of pagnes, 30 sets of earrings and 30 boxes of cosmetics.

loans.name: Rene Eliseo

texts.es:
René, vive con su esposa y su hija de 2 años, él es empleado trabaja en una institucion crediticia, desde hace diez años, todos los días de lunes a sábado.
El necesita el préstamo para reparar su motocicleta (ponerle llantas y otros repuestos) de ese modo la seguirá utilizandola para movilizarse a su trabajo, ya que la zona donde vive es bien retirado de donde trabaja.
El propósito de René es seguir progresando en la institución donde trabaja y ser un buen cliente para otros prestamos futuros y poder ir al día con la cuota.
texts.en:
René lives with his wife and two-year-old daughter.  He is an employee at a loan institution and has been working there for ten years.  He works every day, from Monday to Saturday.  He needs this loan to repair his motorcycle (fitting tires and other spare parts) so that he can continue using it to get to work as the area where he lives is a long way from where he works.

René's goals are to continue making progress in the institution where he works, to be a good client so that he can obtain future loans and to keep up to date with his repayments.

loans.use: to repair his motorcycle (to fit tires and other spare parts)

loans.name: Zoila Carmensa

texts.es: La señora Zoila Carmen tiene su negocio que es la venta de mercadería en general. Desde hace 37 años, que tiene este medio de vida aprendió el oficio como una fuente de empleo que le ayudara a mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. La señora utilizara el préstamo para comprar mayor cantidad de productos por la alta demanda de su negocio y comprar bolsos, cremas, tratamientos, calzado, prendas de plata y ropa en general. Esto le ayudara a tener su negocio mas surtido y a mantener sus ingresos.
texts.en: Zoila Carmen has a business selling general merchandise.  She has been in this business for 37 years and learned the trade as a means of work which would help her to improve her family's quality of life.  She will use her loan to buy a larger quantity of products to meet the high demand she has in her business.  She will buy bags, creams, treatments, footwear, silver jewelry and clothes.  This will help her to keep her business better stocked and to maintain her income.

loans.use: to buy bags, creams, treatments, footwear, silver jewelry and clothes

loans.name: Main Street Group

texts.en:
Suward is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Suward was born in Makeni city 28 years ago. She is married to a trader and the couple has 5 children who are attending primary and secondary schools. Suward sells market food – salt, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), pepper, etc. She has been a businesswoman for many years now. 

With the help of this loan, Suward and her group members will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. Suward is going to use her share of the loan (500,000 SLL) to buy salt, margi, pepper, etc. in large quantity to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy salt, margi, pepper, etc. in large quantity to add to her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy women's and children's sandals, embroidered tops, etc

loans.name: Theonille

texts.en: Theonille is 24 years old. She has two children, ages between three and five, who are both in school. She is married to a farmer. She has been selling foodstuffs such as beans in the market for the last five years. This loan will be used to increase her inventory and buy goods such as beans to sell in her store. Theonille will use the profits to save money for her future and pay school fees for her children. She would like to grow her business and begin selling wholesale.

loans.use: to buy more beans for sale

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es:
Manuel, vive con su familia, su esposa y tres hijos de los cuales solo uno depende económicamente; Manuel se dedica a la siembra de maíz, a la vez es empleado de un beneficio de café, trabaja como vigilante, labora de lunes a sábado desde hace 6 años.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de polines, lamina y teja para instalar el techo a un baño en su vivienda, esto le ayudara para mantener más ordenado su casa y que su familia este en mejores condiciones de vida.
La aspiración de Manuel es proveer a su familia el sustento diario y poder también mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Manuel lives with his family of three children and his wife. Only one of the children depends on him financially. Manuel works growing corn and is also employed on behalf of a café working as a watchman working from Monday through Saturday, and has been doing this for 6 years.

He is asking for a loan in order to buy wooden beams, sheet metal and tiles in order to install a roof for the bathroom for his house. This will help him put his house in order and his family will have better living conditions. Manuel’s dream is to provide his family with their daily bread and to also be able to improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy wooden beams, sheet metal and tiles in order to install a roof

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy pepper, fried cakes, gari, salt, etc. in wholesale to add to her current ones

loans.name: Gloria Marisol

texts.es:
Gloria, es comerciante D. ropa, ella vive con su familia, su esposo y dos hijos, el negocio D. Gloria surgió por iniciativa propia, trabaja D. manera ambulante, no tiene un horario fijo y hasta el momento ha adquirido experiencia.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra D. ropa: blusas, camisas, ropa interior D. dama, la compra le permitirá crecer en el negocio, atender mejor a los clientes y tener mejores ganancias.
Su aspiración es tener un negocio fuerte, abastecido D. ropa nueva, atender un lugar específico, D. preferencia un local propio, para estar más cerca D. la familia.
texts.en:
Gloria sells clothing. She lives with her husband and two children. Gloria grew her business through her own efforts, as a traveling salesperson with no fixed daily schedule, and has obtained experience through working.

She is asking for a loan in order to buy blouses, shirts, and women’s underwear, as these purchases will help her increase her business and to take care of her clients better which will increase her income. 

Her dream is to have a strong business, stocked with new clothing, and have a site for her business in her own home in order to be closer to her family.

loans.use: to buy clothing such as blouses, shirts and women's underwear

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a bale of used clothes for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase dry goods such as sugar, rice, and beans among other products.

loans.name: Jose Faustino

texts.es:
José, vive con su esposa y dos hijos, él se dedica desde hace muchos años a la siembra de granos básicos: maíz, frijol, labora todos los días en las actividades agricolas,de lunes a domingo.
El necesita el préstamo para comprar fertilizantes como; herbicidas para las plagas y semilla para la siembra, abono para que sus cosechas sean abundantes y estén libres de plagas aunque, sabe que es un trabajo arduo pero al final da buenas cosechas y más ingresos.
El sueño de José es que sus hijos sigan estudiando y a traves de su esfuerzo poder ayudar con los gastos de la casa..
texts.en:
José lives with his wife and two children. For many years he has worked growing the basic grains of corn and beans. Every day he farms, Monday through Sunday.

He plans to use this loan to buy fertilizers, herbicides for pest control, seeds to plant, and compost. In this way his crops will be abundant and disease free. Although he knows it is hard work, in the end he has good crops and higher earnings. 

José’s dream is that his children continue studying and through his efforts be able to help with the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy herbicides, seeds, and compost for his crops

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy slippers and eggs for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw materials such as twine and wood for hammocks.

loans.name: Neris Orlando

texts.es:
Neris, vive con su padres, él se dedica desde hace diez años a la siembra de granos básicos: maíz y frijoles todos los días de la semana.
El necesita el préstamo para comprar fertilizantes como; herbicidas para las plagas,semilla y abono para que sus cosechas sean abundantes sin riesgos de plagas, ya que tiene una tierra muy fértil,  le dará mejores  cosechas.
El sueño de Neris es ayudarles a sus padres en los gastos de la casa para que ellos tengan lo necesario para vivir.
texts.en:
Neris lives with his parents.  For ten years he has been sowing basic grains: corn and beans.  He works every day of the week.

Neris needs this loan to buy fertilizers, herbicides, seeds and manure so that his harvests are abundant and aren't threatened by pests.  As he has very fertile land, he will enjoy better harvests.

Neris' dream is to help his parents with their household expenses so that they have what they need to survive.

loans.use: to buy herbicides, seed and manure

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a chainsaw.

loans.name: Teglorma Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “Teglorma” group from Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. They are petty-businesswomen who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva in order to seek for a loan of 800,000 SLL for each in the group. With this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their businesses, attract more customers, make more sales and profit and consequently improve on their living conditions. 

The leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Musu. Musu was born in Tongo town, in eastern Sierra Leone about 35 years ago. She is married to a school teacher and the couple has 4 children – 2 in primary school and 2 in secondary school. Musu has been selling palm-oil and meat for many years now. With her share of this loan, she is going to buy gallons of palm-oil and a large quantity of meat for sale.

loans.use: to buy gallons of palm-oil and a large quantity of meat for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase tools for work such as solder paste, DVD lasers, remote controls and used televisions, among other things.

loans.name: Transito Edenilson

texts.es: Transito,esta solicitando nuevamente un prestamo y lo necesita para comprar abono, herbicidas y semilla para la siembra, estos materiales le serviran para que sus cosechas sean abundantes y estén libres de plagas con la esperanza que le dará cosechas abuntantes, con la cual pueda generar ingresos de la venta de alguna parte de la produccion. Transito continua viviendo con su familia, siempre soltero y agradecido por el apoyo que recibe, pues su fuente de ingreso es unicamente la agricultura, por tal motivo siembra en varias ocaciones al año.
texts.en: Transito is asking for a new loan in order to buy manure, herbicides and seeds for planting. These supplies will help make his harvest abundant and free from pests so that his harvest will be plentiful so he can generate an income from selling part of the harvest. Transito continues living with his family, always single and grateful for the support he receives as his only source of income is his farming. For this reason he plants several times a year.

loans.use: to buy manure, herbicides and seeds.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Antonio y su esposa la señora Maria Elena tienen ya más de seis años dedicándose a la venta de ropa y muebles usados en diferentes partes de la ciudad.
Están solicitando un préstamo para invertir en comprar más mercancía que es (ropa para dama y hombre, muebles, juguetes y accesoria para la cocina) ya que no cuentan con el dinero necesario para invertir en el negocio.
Con las ganancias que obtiene de las ventas del negocio planea pagar el crédito, con el sueldo que recibe de su empleo como chofer de trasporte de personal,  será para los gastos familiares.
Desean que su negocio tenga más mercancía y inversión y poder mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Señor Antonio and his wife Señora Maria Elena have been selling used clothing and furniture in different parts of the city for more than 6 years. They are asking for a loan to purchase more merchandise that is: men's and women's clothing, furniture, toys and kitchen accessories as they do not have the money necessary to invest in the business.

With the earnings from the sale of the merchandise they plan to pay off the loan. He will use the salary he receives from his job as a personnel carrier driver to pay for the family expenses.

They want their business to stock more merchandise and have more investment so as to improve the quality of their children's lives.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for his clothing business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more liquor with which to stock her bar.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay a mechanic for installing shocks and an oil change.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cartons of fresh fish for resale

loans.name: Gbonbotor Rawfish Sellers Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone is very pleased to present to you members of the “Gbonbotor Raw Fish Sellers” group. These are small scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of 500,000.00 SLL each to invest in their businesses. 

Isata is the leader of this group. Isata is 32 years old, married and has three children. Isata sells fresh fish and has been doing this for many years now. With the help of this loan, she will invest in her business by buying cottons of fresh fish to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy cottons of fresh fish to add to her stock

loans.name: Rina Jaqueline

texts.es:
Rina, vive con su esposo, ella se dedica a vender ropa: short, faldas, pantalones, blusas, para damas, caballeros y niños, todos los días  venD. en el mercado, su esposo le  ayuda, desD. hace dos años se dedica a este oficio.
El préstamo lo necesita para comprar más mercadería para surtir su negocio y comprar más ropa: pantalones, camisas, blusas y D. esa forma incrementara sus inventario porque tendrá más variedad D. ropa para ofrecerles a sus clientes.
El sueño D. Rina es, tener una mejor calidad D. vida y en el futuro instalar otro puesto para que su esposo lo administre y obtener más ingresos para ella y su esposo.
texts.en:
Rina lives with her husband.  Her business is selling men's, women's and children's clothes (shorts, skirts, pants and blouses).  She sells her products every day in the market.  Her husband helps her and she has been in this business for two years.

Rina needs this loan to buy more merchandise with which to stock her business and to buy more clothes (pants, shirts and blouses).  This will help her increase her stock and she will have a wider range of clothes to offer her customers.

Rina's dream is to enjoy a better quality of life.  In the future, she hopes to set up another stall for her husband to run and to make more income for herself and her husband.

loans.use: to buy clothes (pants, shirts and blouses)

loans.name: Janilda Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Janilda del Socorro, de 37 años es trabajadora y dueña de su propio negocio de venta de ropa el cual tiene 5 años de administrarlo.

Se ha acercado a la oficina de Ceprodel con el deseo de poder trabajar por medio de un préstamo para la compra de pantalones azulones de varón y mujer, blusas de damas, y camisetas. Con esto podrá incrementar sus ventas y dar un mejor servicio al cliente.
texts.en:
Janilda del Socorro is 37 years old and owns her own clothing sales business, which she has been managing for five years.

She has approached CEPRODEL's office with hopes of being able to work, by means of a loan, to purchase men's and women's blue jeans, ladies' blouses, and shirts. With this she will be able to increase her sales and provide better service to her clients.

loans.use: to purchase men's and women's blue jeans, ladies' blouses, and shirts, etc.

loans.name: Ray Rosario

texts.es:
Ray es una madre de familia de 40 años de edad, vive con su hija en su casa propia, la cual no cuenta con servicios básicos, ubicado en la zona rural del distrito de Chepén que pertenece al departamento de La Libertad. Zona que se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y turismo.

Ray se dedica desde algunos años a la crianza y comercialización de ganado porcino (cerdos), su corral lo tiene en la parte posterior de su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada, una vez que lleguen a su crecimiento óptimo lo puedan ofrecer a sus clientes y con los ingresos que obtenga puede solventar los gastos de su casa.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para comprar más animales de otras especies y su alimento respectivo para los mismos, una vez que se engorden los vende a los diferentes mercados de su zona, con la finalidad de que obtenga un mejor precio por ellos y así pueda tener más ingresos para tener una mejor calidad de vida.  Ray es una persona trabajadora y muy responsable que lo único que quiere es que su hija salga adelante y tenga una mejor educación.
texts.en:
Ray is a 40 year old mother.  She lives with her daughter in her own house, which does not have basic services.  The house is in a rural zone in the Chepén district in the La Libertad department.  The zone is known for its agriculture, its livestock, and its tourism.

Ray has been raising and selling pigs for a few years.  Their pen is located behind her house.  She feeds them balanced feed, and once they have reached their optimum growth she is able to offer them to her customers.  She is able to pay the household expenses with the income that she gets.

She has requested a loan for 2,000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  She will use the loan to buy more animals of different species and their respective feed.  Once they are fattened she will sell them at the different markets in the zone.  Her objective is to get more income in order to have a better quality of life.

Ray is a hard-working and very responsible person.  The only thing that she wants is for her daughter to get ahead and to have a better education.

loans.use: to buy more animals of different species and their respective feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy basic grains, sugar, rice, beans, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Maria Alcira

texts.es:
María de 41 años, vive en su casa propia con su esposo e hijos, no cuenta con servicios básicos, ubicada en el distrito de Sullana que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Esta zona se caracterizan por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

María se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral (ovinos y aves de corral), desde hace 3 algunos años, cuenta con sus corrales apropiados para sus animales, los alimenta con comida balanceada, pastos y granos naturales para engordarlos y pueda venderlos a sus clientes a un buen precio, obteniendo ingresos para solventar sus necesidades familiares.  También cuenta con una pequeña tienda donde ofrece productos de consumo diario para ofrecer a sus clientes, permitiéndole otro ingreso para su casa.

Al observar María que su negocio cada día es más próspero a creído necesario solicitar un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para comprar más alimento balanceado y de mercadería para surtir su tienda, al tenerlos bien alimentados a sus animales tendrá mayores ventas y con los ingresos de ambas actividades podrá cubrir su crédito otorgado, mejorando la calidad de vida de su familia y ofrecer otras oportunidades.
texts.en:
María, age 41, lives in her own house with her husband and her children.  The house, which does not have basic services, is located in the Sullana district in the Piura department.  This zone is known for its agriculture, its livestock, and its handicrafts.

María has been raising and selling farmyard animals (sheep and poultry) for three years.  She has suitable pens for her animals, and she feeds them balanced feed, fodder, and natural grains to fatten them.  Then she will be able to sell them to her customers for a good price.  This way she will get the income needed to pay for the family’s necessities.

She also has a small store where she sells daily consumption products to her customers.  This allows her to have another income for her house.

Upon observing that her business is more prosperous each day, María has believed it necessary to request a loan for 2,000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  The loan is to buy more balanced feed and merchandise to stock her store. 

When her animals are well-fed she will have greater sales.  With the income from both of her business activities she will be able to cover the loan she was granted.  She will also be able to improve her family’s quality of life and offer them other opportunities.

loans.use: to buy more balanced feed and to buy food products to stock her store.

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es:
El señor Guillermo tiene ya más de tres años con su negocio de abarrotes el cual es la fuente de ingreso.
Esta solicitando un préstamo para invertir en comprar de mercancía que es (verduras, fruta, productos de lácteos, quesos, leche, y también reparaciones del cableado de la luz  en el local) ya que para el es muy importante que su negocio este en buen estado y que tenga suficiente mercancía para vender. 
Don Guillermo planea pagar el crédito con las ganancias que obtiene de las ventas del negocio.
texts.en:
Guillermo has now had his grocery business for over three years.  It is his source of income.

He is requesting a loan to buy merchandise such as vegetables, fruit, dairy products, cheese, and milk. The loan is also to repair the wiring to the lighting in his place.  It is very important to him that his business be in a good state and that he has sufficient merchandise to sell.

Guillermo plans to pay for the loan with the income he gets from the sales in his business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise and to repair the lighting in his place.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pasta, detergent and ingredients to make pupusas (cheese and pork).

loans.name: Zebastiana Enilda

texts.es:
Zebastiana tiene 57 años D. edad, es casada y resiD. junto a su familia en el distrito D. Casa GranD., una zona D. actividad agrícola y ganadera que se encuentra ubicada en el departamento D. La Libertad.

Ella  cuenta con una bodega instalada en un puesto en el mercado. Allí ofrece en venta a sus clientes diversos productos D. consumo diario entre productos D. primera necesidad y abarrotes.  Asimismo  su negocio cuenta con una antigüedad D. 10 años y actualmente cuenta con una clientela fija y fidelizada. 

Zebastiana desea ampliar su negocio con la compra D. más mercadería y realizar algunos arreglos en su puesto donD. venD. D. modo que pueda satisfacer la demanda D. sus clientes y brindar cada vez un mejor servicio. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 2000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Zebastiana, 57, is married living with her family in Casa GranD. District, a farming and livestock raising zone located in La Libertad Department.

She has a store located in a market stall.  She offers her customers various daily consumption items and groceries.  The business has been in operation for 10 years and currently has a steady, regular clientele.

Zebastiana wants to expand her business buying more merchandise and to make some repairs to the stand where she sells so that she can meet customer demand and proviD. better service each time.  She, therefore, has felt it convenient to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a 2000 new sol loan.

loans.use: to buy more foodstuffs and to do some repairs to her food store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a photocopier and toner for printing

loans.name: Mirna Dolores

texts.es:
En la fotofrafia aparece la señora Mirna con su hija.

Mirna tiene 36 años de edad, es viuda y vive con sus ocho hijos.

Mirna proviene de una familia que tradicionalmente se ha dedicado a la agricultura como medio de subsistencia, y al servicio como trabajadores de campo para personas que pagan por su trabajo. 

Mirna se dedica a las actividades de comercio desde hace cinco años. Ella se vio obligada a encontrar otra ocupación debido al poco trabajo disponible en el campo, situación causada por los malos inviernos. Actualmente, Mirna reconoce que el comercio le genera mejor rentabilidad y le ofrece mejores oportunidades para su familia.

Mirna viaja en autobús a una ciudad que está a veinte kilómetros de su comunidad para comprar los productos que ella vende. Ella sale de su casa a las 5:00 a.m. a comprar pan y luego lo sale a revender a pie en los parqueos del mercado municipal de la ciudad. Ella regresa a su casa a las 6:00 p.m. con mercadería (frutas, verduras, y condimentos) la que al siguiente día a las 6:00 a.m. sale a vender con la ayuda de dos de sus hijos. En ocasiones Mirna y sus hijos realizan recorridos de hasta cinco kilómetros ofreciendo sus productos a pie, de casa en casa. Mirna paga de contado los productos que compra para la reventa. De esta manera ella consigue un mejor precio, así ella puede vender sus productos a precios más competitivos y obtener una mejor rentabilidad.

Mirna está solicitando un préstamo a Fundación Campo para comprar mercadería y también reparar el techo de su vivienda. Mirna expresa que su vivienda la ha construido con el apoyo de instituciones como Fundación Campo, ya que antes el techo de su casa era de sácate, luego de laminas de aluminio y hoy es de tejas.

Con el préstamo, Mirna podrá brindarles a sus hijos seguridad al mejorar su vivienda y poder tener capital para seguir comercializando. Ella espera seguir dedicándose a las actividades del comercio, y un día establecer una pequeña tienda. Mirna tiene la ilusión de que al menos sus hijos menores (4 años, 2 años, y 6 meses) estudien una carrera de grado técnico superior.
texts.en:
Mirna appears in the photo with her daughter.  Mirna is 36 years old and a widow.  She lives with her 8 children.  She comes from a family that has traditionally been working in agriculture to survive and to work as field hands for people who pay for their services.

Mirna has been working in commercial activities for the last five years.  She was forced into finding this occupation because there was little work available in the fields due to the severe winters.  Currently, Mirna is aware that commerce produces better profits and offers her better opportunities for her family.

Mirna travels by bus to a city that’s 20 kilometers from her community to buy the products she sells.  She leaves home at 5am to buy bread and then goes out on foot to resell it in the city’s municipal market’s parking lots.  She returns home at 6pm with merchandise (fruit, vegetables and condiments) that she goes out the next day at 6am to sell with help from two of her children.  Sometimes Mirna and her children travel up to five kilometers on foot going door to door offering their wares.  Mirna pays cash for the products she buys to resell in order to get the best prices and then sell her products at more competitive prices earning better profits.

Mirna is asking Fundación Campo for a loan to buy merchandise and also to repair her roof.  Mirna states that she’s built her dwelling with support from institutions like Fundación Campo because her roof started out made of grass then became metal sheeting and today is roof tiles.

With the loan, Mirna will be able to provide her children with more security having improved her house and having capital to continue selling.  She hopes to continue working in commerce and one day open a small store.  Mirna hopes that at least her youngest children (4 years old, 2 years old and 6 months old) will study a higher technical career.

loans.use: to repair her roof and to buy products to resell.

loans.name: Norma Alicia

texts.es:
Al negocio de la señora Norma Alicia le esta haciendo falta mas variedad de mercancía que es (zapatos, ropa, de invierno para niños y juguetes nuevos) no cuenta con el dinero necesario para la inversión que desea para si negocio. 
Doña Norma Alicia es madre soltera y tiene dos hijos bajo su responsabilidad y quienes están estudiando y quiere que tengan la educación necesaria para un futuro mejor. 
Con una parte de las ganancias que obtiene de su negocio planea pagar el crédito ya que es la fuente de ingreso que tiene para su familia. 
Desea mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos y tener mas ingreso a su negocio.
texts.en:
Norma Alicia’s business needs more variety of merchandise (shoes, winter clothing for children and new toys).  She does not have the necessary funds to make the investment in her business that she wants to.

Norma Alicia’s a single mother; she has two children in her care who are going to school and she wants them to have the necessary education for a better future.

She plans to use part of the profits she gets from her business to repay the loan since this is her family’s source of income.  She wants to improve her children’s quality of life and to earn more income in her business.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.es:
La señora Maria tiene 44 años y tres hijos.

Ella tiene 12 años de ser comerciante, inicio vendiendo pupusas, mariscos y hoy en día comercializa con ropa, ya que obtiene mayores ganancias. Fue su hermano quien le enseño este negocio.

La señora Maria, vende ropa para damas, caballeros y niños. Ella debe viajar mucho ya que recorre durante la semana tres ciudades, ya que los vende en un mercado de una ciudad dos veces a la semana, luego se traslada una vez por semana a otra ciudad a vender y los otros dos días va hacia otra ciudad del oriente del país. Ella sale desde las 6:00 de la  mañana con uno de sus hijos quien le ayuda a vender y regresan hasta la tarde, para salir de nuevo a vender la ropa a los caseríos aledaños y a sus amigas, ella va de casa en casa a pie, cargando la mercadería para irla ofreciendo, ya que no cuenta con un medio de transporte.

Ella solicita un préstamo a Fundación Campo, para comprar más ropa y de diferentes estilos y también comprara calzado, para revenderlo ya que lo demandan mucho sus clientes y deja buena ganancia y su hijo podrá andar una parte de la mercadería.

De esta forma, ella podrá ofrecer mayores opciones a su clientes teniendo mas estilos y tallas, ya que su inventario es muy poco y lo vende rápido, además podrá llegar a más caseríos cercanos a su comunidad. La señora Maria espera obtener más ingresos y cancelar el crédito, así como el llevar alimentación a su familia.

Ella esta en proceso de negociar un puesto de venta en el mercado. Para tener  un lugar más estable, sin necesidad de trasladarse a pie casa por casa para vender la mercadería, también desea que sus hijos puedan tener su propio negocio.
texts.en:
María, 44, has three children.  She’s been a merchant selling pupusas and seafood for the last 12 years.  At present, though, she sells clothes because they produce higher profits.  Her brother taught her this business.

María sell clothes for women, men and children.  She must travel long distances during the week to three cities because she sells in one of the city’s markets twice a week then goes once a week to another city to sell and the remaining days she goes to another city in the east of the country.  She leaves home at 6am with one of her children who helps her sell and they return in the late afternoon to then go out again to sell clothes in the adjacent hamlets and to her girlfriends.  She goes house to house on foot carrying the merchandise to offer it since she does not have any means of transportation.

She asks Fundación Campo for a loan to buy more clothes in assorted styles and also to buy footwear to resell since many customers are asking for it and it produces good profits and her son can sell some of the merchandise.  In this way, she can offer more options to her customers having more styles and sizes available since her inventory is small and she sells out quickly.  Besides, she’ll be able to reach more nearby settlements.  María hopes to earn more income and repay the loan as well as provide food for her family.

She’s in the process of negotiating for a sales stand in the market to have a more stable place and not have to go on foot door to door to sell her merchandise; she also wants her children to have their own business.

loans.use: to buy assorted clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Gregoria Josefa

texts.es:
Gregoria de 33 años, vive en una zona suburbana llamada “Isla trinitaria”. Una mujer trabajadora que siempre piensa en el futuro de sus hijos.

Ella al ver que nadie le daba trabajo, por su situación de estar embarazada decido abrir su propio negocio. El negocio de ella es un cyber que esta ubicada en la parte delantera de su vivienda.

Con la ayuda de su esposo ha podido conseguir dos computadoras para el uso de los clientes. Su actividad se inicia a las 8:00am hasta 11:00pm. Solicita el préstamo para invertir en su negocio e incrementar accesorios para el uso su negocio como: parlantes, cámaras, mouse, etc.

Su sueño es tener su cyber ubicado en un local grande donde pueda tener un ingreso económico y el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Gregoria is 33 years old and lives in a suburban area called, Isla Trinitaria; she is a hard-worker and is always thinking of her children's futures.

Gregoria decided to open her own business after noting that no one would employ her due to being pregnant.  She has a computer lab located in the front part of her home.

With her husband's help, she has been able to obtain two computers for her customers to use and she works from 8AM to 11PM.  She is soliciting this loan in order to invest in her business and obtain accessories such as: speakers, cameras, mouse, etc..

Her dream is to have a computer lab at a bigger location where she can have an income for the well being of her family.

loans.use: to purchase cameras, speakers, mouse

loans.name: Marta Lidia

texts.es:
Marta, esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo que lo necesita para comprar más mercadería para surtir su negocio y comprar más ropa: vestidos,pantalones, camisas, blusas y D. esa forma incrementara sus ganancias porque tendrá más variedad para ofrecerles a sus clientes.
Ella esta contenta con el aporte D. estos prestamos, los cuales le han ayudado para mejorara la diversidad D. sus productos para ofrecer a los clientes.
texts.en:
Marta is requesting a new loan, which she needs to buy more merchandise to stock her business.  She needs to buy more clothing; dresses, pants, shirts, and blouses.  By offering her customers a greater variety, her income will increase.

She is happy with the help from these loans.  They have helped her to improve the diversity of the products she offers her customers.

loans.use: to buy dresses, pants, shirts, and blouses.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Maria Milagro De Los Angeles

texts.es: María, se ha decidico por un nuevo préstamo, que lo utilizara para comprar materia prima como (maíz, quesillo chicharon) y comprar un cedazo de maya, para arreglar el local donde tiene el negocio, de esa forma podrá tener más lo necesario para realizar la venta y mantener a su clientela bien atendedida. Ella logra mantener el negocio con el aporte que recibe de los prestasmo, tanto el anterior como este, sera un gran apoyo, ya que se le hace facil por cada venta ahorrar la cuota para pagar.
texts.en:
María has decided upon a new loan to buy ingredients like corn, cheese, and “chicharon” (fried pork rinds).  She will also buy a wire mesh sifter to set up her place of business.  This way she will be able to have more than the basics to make her sales and to keep her customers well-tended to.  

She will manage to keep her business with the help she receives from the loans.  This loan, as much as the previous one, will be of great help.  It makes it easy for her to save from each sale in order to make her payments

loans.use: to buy ingredients like corn, cheese, and “chicharon” (fried pork rinds) to make "pupusas" (a thick corn tortilla stuffed with cheese, fried pork rind, chicken, or refried beans).

loans.name: Joaquin Orlando

texts.es:
Joaquín, vive con su esposa y sus  hijos, él administra una tienda donde vende productos de primera necesidad (arroz, frijoles, azúcar) y también trabaja de agricultura (maíz y frijoles), todos los días trabaja sin horario establecido.
El necesita el préstamo para comprar mercadería para surtir su negocio aceite, arroz, frijoles, azúcar, jabon, de esa forma tendrá más oportunidades de vender y que los clientes.
El sueño de Joaquín  es que sus hijos sigan estudiando y de esa forma ayudar con los gastos de la casa.
texts.en:
Joaquín lives with his wife and children.  He runs a store that sells basic needs products (rice, beans, sugar).  He also works as a farmer (corn and beans) every day without an established schedule.
