Candida has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF.  She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy additional stocks of vegetables to sell.

She dreams of saving money to expand her business and buy a delivery truck for her business.

loans.use: To buy additional stocks of vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Clarita works hard to support her family.

She has a tailoring business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from buying and selling of jewelry. 

Clarita is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy additional linens, threads and other materials for her tailoring business.

Clarita has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: To buy additional linens, threads and other materials for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy paint, nails, and furniture to repair and improve their house and lodging business.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 44 years old, married and has two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Josephine runs a dried fish (boneless danguit) business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more dried fish to sell.

Josephine has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, Josephine would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more dried fish to sell

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 40 years old, married and has three children.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Gloria has been raising livestock for six years and also earns additional income from fish vending.

Gloria is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy more livestock to sell.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more livestock to sell.

loans.name: Revilla

texts.en:
Revilla is 39 years old, married and has one child. Revilla works very hard to provide for her family.

Revilla runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Revilla has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, snack foods and other groceries. 

In the future, Revilla would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her child to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Pelagia

texts.en: Pelagia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has operated a fish-selling business in the Philippines for six years. She earns additional income from a variety store. Pelagia, who has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of loans from NWTF, is requesting a new loan of  PHP 20,000 to buy more fish to sell in her food stall. She dreams of saving enough to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Nemesia

texts.en:
Nemesia, 43, is a married woman with 10 children, three of whom are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Nemesia has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines. Abaca is a palm leaf fiber used in handicrafts. Nemesia has been in this business for three years. 

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials for her abaca weaving business.

Nemesia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for her abaca weaving business.

loans.name: Rayma

texts.en:
Rayma, 43, is married and has five children of whom two are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Rayma has an abaca making business in the Philippines. Abaca is palm leaf fiber used in handicrafts. Rayma has been in this business for 18 years.

Rayma requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials for her abaca making business.

 In the future, Rayma would like to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for her abaca making business.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion, 47, is married and has five children, two of whom are in school.

Concepcion is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Concepcion has been raising pigs for five years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Concepcion requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

In the future, Concepcion would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is a hard-working entrepreneur who sells personal products in the Philippines. Daisy has been in this business for 10 years, and she earns additional income from fishing.

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase items like body lotion and perfumes to sell to customers.

Daisy has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to buy a fishing boat in the future.

loans.use: to purchase items like body lotion and perfumes to sell to customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, fish, seasonings and soft drinks to be cooked and sold in her food stall.

loans.name: Jalela

texts.en:
For the 18 months Jalela, who is 23 years of age and married, has been selling a variety of clothes for women, men, and children, all of a very good quality and at accessible prices. With the profit generated, she is able to pay their house rent, electric bill and water bill monthly.

One of Jalela's goals is to improve and expand her business. Because the Christmas season is approaching, in order to generate greater profits she is requesting a loan of P20,000 to restock her shop. Over time, she hopes to achieve financial security for her family.

loans.use: to restock her clothing sales business.

loans.name: Tep

texts.en: From Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia, Mrs. Tep is a 21-year-old woman who has been engaged in agricultural work for many years. She is married to a man who has the same kind of job. Now they are blessed with two lovely children. Neither attends school. Mrs. Tep is busy with her work because, besides farming for six months, she spends her time making baskets and other objects, weaving together thin, bendable strips of wood to sell to local tradesmen. With the coming rainfall, Mrs. Tep has some concerns about her rice crop because it is not growing well, due to the lack of fertilizers to spread on her farmland. To solve the problem, Mrs. Tep is requesting some funds from Kiva to purchase mineral fertilizers for her crop. With the remaining money, she wishes to buy some pigs for breeding behind her house. As for her prospects, Mrs. Tep hopes that she will be able to provide her children the opportunity to join the university.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers and to buy some pigs for breeding

loans.name: Ceasaria

texts.en:
Ceasaria is a married woman with one child. She owns a farm in the town of Trinidad, Bohol. She has been growing and selling rice for more than 20 years. Aside from farming, Ceasaria also makes bread that she sells to the people in her community.

Ceasaria has requested this loan to purchase flour for baking, and, for her other business, fertilizers and other farm inputs. Ceasaria hopes to own a bigger farm in the future.

loans.use: to purchase flour for baking, as well as fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Victor

texts.en: Victor is 58 years old and lives in Calube Aloran, Misamis Occidental. He is married with three children. Victor has a fish-vending business and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work. He has requested a loan of 14,900 PHP to purchase more fish to sell. Victor has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, Victor hopes to have a fishing boat. Victor is a MIGS member of PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Arlinda

texts.en: Arlinda, a 58-year-old married mother of eight, lives in Sebasi, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines, where she has been growing corn for six years. A member of Paglaum Multipurpose Cooperative for one year, she is requesting a loan of PHP12,000 to purchase fertilizers for the maintenance of her corn production. In the future, Arlinda hopes to be successful in her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for the maintenance of her corn production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy baskets, soft brooms, and chairs to sell

loans.name: Sinon

texts.en:
Sinon, pictured with her loom, is a silk weaver and her husband, Phan, is a motor taxi driver. They have been married since 1980 and have six children: two sons and four daughters. Four of their children are married and live in separate homes and the other two attend school. The family lives in a village across the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.  

Sinon is requesting another 300 USD loan to buy silk material. She hopes to continue her tradional weaving business.

loans.use: to buy silk for her weaving business

loans.name: Burulush's Group

texts.en:
Burulush is 59 years old and is married to a farmer. She is the leader of this group. Together with her husband, Burulush has raised two sons and three daughters. Her older son is married and works in Bishkek, her second is in Russia, and her two younger daughters study at university. In order to earn money to meet their daily needs, the family cultivates agricultural products. They started this activity ten years ago with an initial investment of 8,000 KGS and now their monthly profit from selling their harvest is about 3,000 KGS.  

Burulush is requesting a loan to purchase 20 liters of fuel and hire labor for the harvest.  In the future, she hopes to use the profits gained with her loan to purchase cattle for breeding.


--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan.
 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase fuel and hire farm labor

loans.name: Sarin

texts.en:
Sarin, pictured here, sells grocery items from her home. She lives in a village along National Road Number Two approximately thirteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She has been married since 1984 and has three children: two sons and a daughter. One of her children is a garment worker, one is an electrician, and another one works for a hotel. 

Sarin is asking for a 1,000 USD loan to purchase a motorcycle for her son, who is an electrician, to use to get work.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for her son

loans.name: Bashiraan's Group

texts.en:
Bashiraan is a very supportive lady who works with her husband to run a business selling thread rolls. She sells her product to thread sellers in her local market and her work supplements her family’s income. Bashiraan has two daughters and a son. Her son is a mason and her daughters stay at home and do housework. 

Bashiraan is requesting a loan from the Kiva partner Asasah to expand her family business and buy rolls of thread in bulk to sell to customers. She is hopeful that this loan will make their business more profitable by increasing sales and profits.

Note: "In the photo, one of the members has decoration pieces selling business thats why they are holding decoration pieces".

loans.use: to buy rolls of thread

loans.name: Nasira

texts.en:
Nasira is 29 years old, married and has 3 children. Her youngest son is only 2 years old, while others are getting their education by going to a nearby school. Nasira sews clothes. She started this work when her children started their education. She is very skillful in her work and receives a good number of orders every month. Her earnings allow her to pay off the school fees of her children. 

Nasira's husband operates a grocery store in the market. He sells different daily use items from his store like sugar, spices, rice, lentils, snacks, etc.. He is very good in his customer dealings and his rates are also very fair, therefore he attracts good customers at his store. 

Nasira has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her husband’s grocery store business. With the loan, he will put larger quantities of groceries in his store which will allow him to fulfill the demand of his customers and increase his sales and profits. She is very hopeful that her husband, who has been operating his business for the past 5 years, will successfully be able to improve his business condition after investing a loan into it.

loans.use: to buy groceries for her husband's grocery store business

loans.name: Malou

texts.en:
Malou believes that through patience and hard work, she will become successful in life. She is now 33, married and has five school-age children. Malou and her husband aim to earn and save more income to acquire their basic needs and support the schooling of their children. They want them to earn a degree and become professionals someday. Despite the hardships in life, they are striving hard to support their family.

To generate income, Malou is engaged in buying and selling of handicrafts in their community while her husband manages their farm. She wants to acquire more handicrafts to sell, but her capital is not sufficient. Therefore, she wants to ask for additional capital of 20,000 PHP to buy chairs, baskets, soft brooms and more furniture to sell. She is hoping that this loan will help a lot to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy chairs, baskets, soft brooms and more furniture to sell

loans.name: Khoem

texts.en:
Khoem, 49, is living in Kompong Speu Province, Cambodia. She lives with Lin, 51, and their four lovely children that they care for and provide a good education for. Khoem strives to provide the best for her family members. She works hard for them in her fields planted with rice, corn and potatoes. She’s been in this line of work for many years on land of her own. From this business activity, she can earn approximately $3USD per day. 

Due to the rainy season, Khoem would like to purchase seeds, fertilizer and other farming materials for supporting her farm. Due to lack of money, she wishes to request some funds through HKL partner with Kiva. This is her first loan with HKL partner, therefore she’s hoping for a small loan to reach her objectives. She is naturally predisposed to repay her loan punctually. She hopes that this loan will make her family meet happiness and prosperity all the time. 

In the future, she wishes to have a larger house.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer and other farming materials

loans.name: Tep

texts.en:
At the age of 44, Mr. Tep is the father of three children and he works tirelessly towards his dream of having a big farm for raising and fattening pigs. Mr. Tep and his wife have been involved in hog-raising since 2000. From this business, this couple is able to earn about 5 USD per day to sustain their financial and daily needs. Day to day Mr. Tep looks for good ways to generate more income because he wants to have a better quality of life and living standard for his family. 

Recently, Mr. Tep has found a new job: buying rice from the local farmers at a low price and then transporting it to sell in other areas that need it. However, Mr. Tep does not have his own transportation for starting up this business. So he is asking for help from Kiva’s lenders in order to purchase a motorbike for his new business. Mr. Tep hopes that with the increased in income, he will be able to buy feed, vaccines and vitamins for his pigs and to grow his existing business to secure his family living.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to transport rice

loans.name: Nazgul's Group

texts.en:
Nazgul is the leader of this group. She is 27 and married to an electrician. Together with her husband, she brings up three children; the older one studies at school and the other two are preschool age (under seven). 

A year ago, Nazgul sold a harvest and with an initial investment of 10,000 KGS, she opened a pavilion, where she sells grocery goods. At the moment a trade in the pavilions runs well. The monthly profit is about 11,000 KGS. With money received from the loan, Nazgul wants to purchase more products in order to increase the variety of goods she sells. She plans to purchase more beverages, cookies, chocolate, detergents, etc.. In the future, she plans to start repairing the house.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase beverages, detergents, cookies, etc.

loans.name: Kim

texts.en: From Kompong Speu Province, Cambodia, Mrs. Kim is a hard working woman who lives with her husband and her four lovely children. All of her children are attending school. What she most wants is to offer her family a better quality of life. Currently, Mrs. Kim has a business as a mixed goods seller in front of her house where she can earn about $2USD for each day. She has been involved with this kind of business for ages with her husband. She sells different products, such as beauty products, sugar, candy, beers, noodle, snacks, etc.  This is her main source of income. At the moment, the business is doing well and gives her family enough income to survive. But Kim doesn’t want to remain the same; her dream is to see her business grow where customers can find anything they need. This is why she has asked for the loan: to invest in her expanding business. Kim has placed her faith in God that she will be able to achieve her goals and that she will be able to have a better life. The loan will be used to buy beauty products, beers and grocery goods. Kim hopes to be able to achieve everything she sets out to do and to be able to give her family a better quality of life. In the future, she will send her children to get a good education at university. This is her first loan with HKL, a Kiva partner. She is very grateful to all the kind investors who help her family.

loans.use: to purchase more mixed goods.

loans.name: Zamira's Group

texts.en:
Zamira is the leader of this group. She is 42 and married to a farmer. The children are employed and live independently from their parents. Ten years ago Zamira purchased two calves for breeding and since that time she has been engaged in cattle breeding. She sells milk products.  In this way she earns about 4000 soms to meet the family needs. At the moment, she applies for the loan because she needs money to purchase feed for cattle. In the future she plans to increase the number of cattle and expand her milk sales business.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase feed for cattle

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married, with 9 children.  Elizabeth has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 9000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages .
Elizabeth has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Elizabeth hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Sam Aun

texts.en:
Sam Aun (in the picture) is now a garment worker. She used to be a weaver. Her husband, Saman is a security guard. They have been married since 1991 and have one son and one daughter. Their son is now in first year of  university and their daughter is still in high school. The family is living on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Sam Aun is requesting a loan of US$ 1,000 to purchase a motorbike for her son to drive to school.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her son to drive to school.

loans.name: Socheat

texts.en:
Socheat is 22 years old and single. She lives with her sons and parents in a village outside of Phnom Penh. Her parents are rice farmers. 

Socheat is a garment worker. She is asking for her first loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike to drive to work.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to drive to work.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en: Wilson lives peacefully with his family in the Philippines. He is 31 years old and married. He has two children who inspire him to work hard. Wilson’s wife is a housekeeper and his partner in life. Wilson has run a hog-raising business for two years. He earns approximately P2,000 a month in his business, which he uses for household expenses. He wants to earn a higher income from the business to save some of it for the future of his family. Wilson is requesting a loan of P25,000 to buy additional piglets to raise and feed for maintenance. Wilson wishes to expand and maintain his business for his continued source of income.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise and feed for maintenance.

loans.name: Emeliana

texts.en:
Emeliana is 53 years old and is a married woman with six children. The oldest child is 29 years old while the youngest is only 5.

Emeliana and her husband work together to support their family. They are engaged in farming and fishing businesses. According to Emeliana, they have been growing and selling rice for 15 years. Emeliana's husband operates a fishing boat and she is the one who sells his catch.

Emeliana has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers, fishing nets and hooks. Emeliana hopes to have a stable business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, fishing nets and hooks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional inventory of shoes and slippers

loans.name: Pok

texts.en:
Pok (in the photo) is 55 years old and her husband, Noun, is 57 years old. They have been married for almost 35 years and have three married daughters. Two of their daughters live in separate homes and another still lives in their family home. The family lives in a village outside of Phnom Penh City. 

Pok is a rice farmer. She is asking for her first loan of 200 USD to purchase spare parts for her motorized hand tiller (wheels).

loans.use: To purchase wheels for her motorized hand tiller

loans.name: Emilda

texts.en: 46-year-old Emilda is a married woman with two children, ages 20 and 26. She is a seaweed farmer and has been engaged in this kind of business for 15 years. Emilda earns about 6,000 PHP per month from this business. She plans to use her loan to purchase seaweed seedlings, straw, wooden pegs, and other materials. Emilda hopes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase seaweed seedlings, straw, wooden pegs, and other materials

loans.name: Samat

texts.en:
Samat (pictured with her loom), 40, is a weaver. Her husband, Bunly (41), is a rice farmer and raises cows at home. They have been married since 1992 and have two sons. One is a construction worker and another is in school. The family is living in a village across the Mekong River about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Samat is asking for a loan of 400 USD to assist her husband’s farming business by buying seed, fertilizer, and pesticides to maintain his rice farm.

loans.use: To buy seed, fertilizer, and pesticides

loans.name: Florentina

texts.en:
Florentina is 52 years old and widowed. She has six children for whom she is responsible. Her family's main business is agriculture, particularly pigs and rice farming. Three of her children are in charge of looking after and maintaining their rice fields. 

Florentina has raised hogs for almost 17 years. In addition, she also buys and sells bananas. According to her, she buys her product at Sta. Maria Alfonso Lista, Ifugao. She desires to increase her income in order to continuing meeting the needs of her family. Due to increased household expenses, she couldn't buy additional bananas and feed for her piglets. For this reason, she is requesting additional capital of 7,000 PHP to purchase bananas and feed supplies for raising piglets.

In the future, Florentina hopes to successfully raise all of her piglets and sell them at a very good price so that she can improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy bananas and feed for piglets

loans.name: Maqsoodan's Group

texts.en:
Maqsoodan is a 43-year-old lady who supports her family with her sewing business. She operates her business from her home. Her earnings allow her to pay the education fees for her children so they can continue their education and improve their lives. 
 
Maqsoodan has four children: three daughters and one son. Her eldest daughter has completed her education to 10th standard and now works as a nurse in order to financially contribute to the family. Her second daughter is in 10th standard, while her younger daughter is in 9th standard. Her son is not yet old enough to attend school.
 
Her husband is a driver. He drives a rickshaw and provides transportation to his passengers. He has been in this profession for the past ten years. Maqsoodan has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will repair his rickshaw because it is currently not operating properly and doesn’t allow him to drive on longer routes. With a fully-repaired rickshaw, her husband will be able to continue his business and provide his services to more passengers.

loans.use: To repair a rickshaw

loans.name: Nuruipa's Group

texts.en:
Nuruipa, the leader of this group, is 50 years old, married to a tractor driver, and the mother of a son who is employed and a daughter who is studying at university.

In order to earn money to meet the family's daily needs, Nuruipa takes orders and sews Kyrgyz national blankets and pillows. As well, the couple cultivates agricultural products. This year they are growing potatoes and wheat, but Nuruipa needs financial help to collect the harvest. With money received from the loan she will purchase fuel and hire labor.

In the future she plans to continue supporting her daughter's education and purchase home furniture to improve the family's living conditions.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year.

To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase fuel and hire labor to collect the harvest.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda is a 61-year-old married woman with four children. She lives in the town of Trinidad, Bohol where she tills a land with her husband. They primarily grow rice crops to sell. Erlinda does her best to support her family. She requested this loan to purchase seeds and fertilizers. Erlinda hopes to have a stable income. She also desires to help send her grandchildren to school.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Ma. Eva

texts.en:
Ma.Eva is married with eight children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ma.Eva is 53 years old and has three of her children in school.

Ma.Eva has a videoke rentals business in the Philippines. Ma.Eva requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase chairs and other materials for her videoke business.

Ma.Eva has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Ma.Eva would like to save enough, so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase chairs and other materials for her videoke business.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 21 years old, and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 
Mary Jane has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for four years. She requested a loan of PHP 13,000 to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.
She has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Mary Jane hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en:
Eduardo Jr. is now 41 years old and chooses to be single. He lives with his parents in a village, planting and harvesting rice for sale. He has been in this business for nearly 20 years and usually earns a profit of P25,000 in every harvest season. Eduardo uses his income for his daily consumption and saves some for future emergencies. He dreams of becoming financially stable in the future to help his parents who are rapidly aging.

Due to the high cost of commodities, Eduardo is asking for a loan of P10,000 to buy fertilizers and pesticides for the maintenance of his rice farming business. He believes that through his patience and hard work, he will make improvements to increase his income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides for rice farming.

loans.name: Lonie

texts.en: Lonie is 35 years old. She is separated from her husband and has four children. Lonie has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan for PHP 11,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages. Lonie has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Lonie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is 49 years old. She is married and has four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Milagros has a business buying and selling dried fish (boneless danguit) in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 16000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional dried fish to sell.

Milagros has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Milagros would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Noneta

texts.en:
Noneta is 55 years old, married, and has 2 children.

Noneta works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying and selling rock salt in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 24000 loan through NWTF to buy more sacks of rock salt to sell.

Noneta has borrowed and paid back 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her business of buying and selling rock salt for 2 years, and also earns an income from food vending.

Noneta aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rock salt to sell.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is 48 years old. She is married and has 3 children.

She has a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Tessie is borrowing PHP 19500 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.Tessie has been pig fattening for 6 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling fruits and vegetables.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Lota

texts.en:
Lota is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has one child. 

Lota has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Lota has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Lota hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 27 years.

Marilyn requested a PHP 14,500 loan through NWTF to purchase more fishing gear and other equipment. 

In the future, Marilyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Celerina

texts.en:
Celerina is 39 years old.  She is married and has 3 children who are in school.

Celerina is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional pigs to sell.

Celerina has been raising pigs for 7 years now, and has borrowed 11 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Celerina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional pigs to sell.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn, a 29-year-old married woman from Trinidad, Bohol, has two children aged four and eight. The operator of a sari-sari store business for the past year, Evelyn sells items such as bread, chips, vinegar, and soap, earning 3000 PHP per month. She has requested this loan to buy more items to sell such as softdrinks, canned goods and rice, and hopes for her store to grow bigger.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as softdrinks, canned goods and rice.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn, a 27-year-old married resident of  the Philippines, has operated a shop selling canned goods, snacks and beverages for the past five years. A member of HSPFI since 2010, Jocelyn is requesting a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages, and hopes to improve her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages for her shop.

loans.name: Kristi Colleen

texts.en: Kristi Colleen, a hardworking entrepreneur who has operated an Internet cafe business in the Philippines for four years, is requesting a loan of PHP 29500 through NWTF to purchase an additional computer and spare parts for her enterprise.  Kristi Colleen, who earns additional income from buying and selling of imported products (lotion, perfumes, etc.) has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase an additional computer and spare parts for maintenance.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en: Lolita is 54 years old and married with five children. She works hard to provide for her family by running a business buying and selling firewood and charcoal in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of firewood and charcoal to sell. Lolita has borrowed and repaid 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her firewood and charcoal business for 15 years and also earns an income from selling bananas and vegetables. She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional firewood and charcoal to sell

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en: Carmen is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. Carmen is providing motorela or habal-habal services with her husband as the driver. She has had this business for 10 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy gasoline and tools for the maintenance of her vehicle. Carmen has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy gasoline and tools for the maintenance of her vehicle

loans.name: Ginalyn

texts.en: Ginalyn is 29 years old and married with two children aged 6 and 2. Her husband is a fisherman. Ginalyn and her husband work together to support their family. Ginalyn sells her husband's catch at their local market. She also buys crabs from other fishermen and resells them. Ginalyn works hard to help provide for their needs. She requested this loan to buy fishing nets and hooks and more crabs to sell. Ginalyn hopes for this loan to help improve their business.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and hooks and more crabs to sell

loans.name: Alemar

texts.en: As a married mother of four children, Alemar works hard to support her family. She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Alemar is borrowing PHP 18000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts for her motorcycle transport business. She has been sustaining her business activities for the past 7 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for her motorcycle business

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. Jocelyn has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages. Jocelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Lida

texts.en:
Lida is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing and fish vending business in the Philippines.
 
She is borrowing PHP 24,000 through NWTF to buy additional fishing nets for her business.

Lida has been in this business for 27 years. She earns additional income from oyster culture and green shell culture.

Lida has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing nets for her business.

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
With the help of a previous loan, Pov (pictured at her loom), continues her silk weaving business. In addition, she buys more finished silk fabrics from other weavers in her village and sells them in other provinces away from her house.
 
Her husband, Aun, is a farmer. The couple has been married since 1983 and live on an island in the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Pov is asking for another loan in the amount of $500 to purchase weaving materials for her weaving business and to buy additional silk fabrics for sale.

loans.use: to purchase weaving materials for her weaving business and buy additional silk fabrics for sale.

loans.name: Romana

texts.en:
Romana is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed.
 
Romana has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Romana has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Sinat

texts.en:
Sinat (pictured above) is 47 years old and her husband, Sokorn is 48 years old. They live about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1988 and have three children - one son and two daughters. One is a security guard, one assists her mother in farming business and another one is in school.

Sinat and her husband are vegetable farmers. She is asking for her first loan of the amount of US$1,000 to buy a motorbike for her son who is a security guard to get work.  

Photo: Sinat is at home, not at the farm.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her son to get work.

loans.name: Nasreen Naz's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen Naz is 51 years old  and owns and operates a seamstress business at her home. She does this work to supplement the income for her family. 
She is the mother of two children: a son and a daughter. Her son is 19 years old and completed his education to the 5th standard. Now he operates an animal food business. He contributes to his family financially from his work. Nasreen Naz's daughter is 11 years old and stays at home. 
Her husband is a daily wage laborer.
  
Nasreen has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her son’s business. With the loan, he will buy animal food in a larger quantity for selling.  
Nasreen is hopeful that an investment will bring positive financial changes to his business.

loans.use: To buy animal food for selling

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 64 years old and married, with 3 children.

Lucia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like shampoo, groceries, etc., in her sari-sari store.

Lucia has borrowed and repaid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 10 years and also earns an income from rice retailing & food vending.

Lucia aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy items to sell

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married, with 4 children. 
Evelyn is providing motorela or habal-habal services with her husband as the driver. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy tools & pay for gasoline and for maintenance.
Evelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Evelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools & pay for the gasoline for maintenance

loans.name: Srom

texts.en: Ms. Srom is a hard-working and conscientious person, located in Baray district of Kompong Thom Province, Cambodia. She is married to the loving father of their two kids, who attend school .  What she most wants is to offer her children a better quality of life. Presently, she is a sewing factory worker in Phnom Penh city, where she can get enough salary to cover her family’s expenses. To assist her income, her lovely husband is a local construction worker. From this type of business, he can earn $9 for each day. To upgrade their living conditions, this humble couple wish to build a house.  However,  they lack equity so they would like to request some funds through HKL, a partner with Kiva.  Srom expects that, through this loan, her family will find happiness and prosperity. Srom wants to have her children educated to a high level. This is her third loan with HKL and the first loan with Kiva as a partner. This humble couple sends thanks in advance to all generous lenders who always help her family.

loans.use: to build a  house.

loans.name: Hel

texts.en:
Mrs. Hel, 62, is a basket maker who lives in Kompong Chhnang province. Her husband is also a basket maker. Together, this couple is able to earn approximately of $3.50 USD per day for living. They live with four single children at home.  The other two children have been married and started new homes. Mrs. Hel is a patient woman with her job and always takes care of the family.

Currently, one of her grandchildren has passed the exam to work in Korea as a worker. However, her grandchild doesn’t have enough money to buy an airplane ticket for traveling to Korea. Thus, Mrs. Hel would like ask for a loan through HKL, one of Kiva’s partners, to help her grandchild purchase an airplane ticket. In the future, Mrs. Hel wishes to see all her descendants have bright futures and make a living by themselves.

loans.use: to buy an airplane ticket for traveling to Korea.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is 38 years old and has five children. She is married and four of her children are in school.

Margie is in the agricultural business, buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. Margie requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional livestock to sell.

Margie has been buying and selling livestock for eight years now. She has borrowed 17 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Margie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional livestock to sell

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita is 45 years old and married with three children.

Mercedita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store (local convenience store) in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell in her sari-sari store.

Mercedita has borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 20 years and also earns an income from buying and selling of rice grains & corn.

Mercedita aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married, with 10 children. Emma has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 2 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages .
Emma has been a member of HSPFI since 2009.  In the future, Emma hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia is 65 years old and married, with 4 children.  Ofelia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her sari-sari store.

Ofelia has borrowed and repaid 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store  for 10 years and also earns an income from food vending.  Ofelia aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more stock to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Savang

texts.en:
Savang (pictured here) and his wife, Sreytouch, have been married since 1974 and have four sons and three daughters. Three are married and live outside the family home, three are garment workers and another one is in school. They live in a village outside of Phnom Penh City.

Savang is a retired policeman. He and his wife now are rice farmers. He is asking for his first loan of $1,000 to purchase cows to use on his rice farm.

loans.use: To purchase cows to use on his rice farm.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married, with 2 children. 
Marilyn has a shop that sells clothing & beauty products from NATASHA & AVON. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy stock from NATASHA & AVON to sell.
Marilyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Marilyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stock from NATASHA & AVON to sell

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is 56 years old and married with seven children.

Patricia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries in her sari-sari store.

Patricia has borrowed and paid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for three years and also earns an income from rice retailing.

Patricia aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Sreysros

texts.en:
Sreysros (in the photo) is single. She lives with her sister and widowed mother in a village off of National Road number 2, near Phnom Penh City.

Sreysros is a garment worker and she also operates a tailoring business at home when she is free. She is asking for a loan of 1,200USD to build a restroom for her family's use and to put an addition on her house.

loans.use: To build a restroom for family use and to put an addition on her house.

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
Sally is 47 years old and married with four children.

Sally works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell.

Sally has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for six years and also earns an income from farm equipment & pig retailing.

Sally aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married, with 6 children. 
Jacqueline has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & bananas. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & bananas.
Jacqueline has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Jacqueline hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & bananas

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Avelina works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from raising pigs.  Avelina is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase a fishing net for her fishing/fish vending business.

Avelina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase fishing net for her business.

loans.name: Diosdada

texts.en:
Diosdada works hard to support her family. Diosdada is married and has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines.

Diosdada requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials for the repair of her fishing boat. She has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Diosdada would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy materials for the repair of her fishing boat.

loans.name: Soeun

texts.en: Fish is the main fresh food for most people, in particular the families who depend on fishing and fish selling. Mrs. Soeun is one of those people who currently depends on selling fish at the local busy market. She sells fish that she gets from her husband’s fishing or buys from her wholesale supplier. Soeun is a humble mother who has been blessed with three lovely children who are living under her care. From this type of business activity, Soeun can earn approximately $4USD for each day. Soeun and her husband have been in this business since 2000. To upgrade their living standards, Soeun and her modest husband would like to purchase fishing equipment but lack the cash.  She has decided, with her husband, to request funds through HKL, a partner with Kiva. She expects that these funds will improve her revenue. She and her husband are very thankful to all kind lenders who always help her family. This is her third cycle of her loans with HKL and the first loan with Kiva partner. She expects to have a a comfortable house, and send her children to get a good education at a high level.

loans.use: to purchase fishing materials.

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en:
Ligaya is 38 years old and married with seven children.

Ligaya works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional item to sell for her sari-sari store.

Ligaya has borrowed and repaid 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for six years and also earns an income from buying and selling chicken and fish.

Ligaya aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy additional item to sell in her sari-sari (variety) store.

loans.name: Anacela

texts.en:
Anacela is 40 years old and married, with 3 children of school age.  With 3 children in school, Anacela works very hard to provide for them.

Anacela runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her sari-sari store.

Anacela has been in this business for 6 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, milk, soap, sardines, noodles, etc.. 

In the future Anacela would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional items, like sugar, milk, soap, etc., to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Jasmin

texts.en:
Jasmin is 43 years old and married with four children who are in school. Jasmin works very hard to provide for them.

Jasmin runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of goods to sell.

Jasmin has been in this business for seven years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, soap, spices, noodles, etc.

In the future Jasmin would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of goods to sell.

loans.name: Anabella

texts.en:
Anabella is 27 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single, with 2 children. 
Anabella has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages .
Anabella has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Anabella hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is 42 years old and married with four children.

Daisy works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her sari-sari store.

Daisy has borrowed and repaid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 10 years and also earns an income from buying and selling rice, charcoal and ready-to-wear.

Daisy aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell in her sari-sari (variety) store.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 57 years old and married with three children.

Erlinda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell.

Erlinda has borrowed and repaid 9 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 10 years and also earns an income from motorcycle transport, rice retailing and buying and selling charcoal.

Erlinda aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Wissam

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 30 years old, married and lives with five family members. One of them works.

Wissam has been an owner of a market since 2005, selling soft drinks, juices, cheese and dairy products and household items. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs; he has sufficient experience in this field. His market is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by.

He is requesting a $2000 loan in order to renovate and redecorate his market and add more shelves. He is aiming to earn more profit to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to renovate and redecorate his market and add more shelves.

loans.name: Delilah

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Delilah works hard to support her family.

She has a boarding house rentals business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store. Delilah is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy materials for the upkeep of her boarding house rentals.

Delilah has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for the upkeep of her boarding house rentals.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children.

Josephine has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has operated this business for 10 years. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 5,000 PHP to buy additional inventory (more canned goods, snacks and beverages).

Josephine has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Josephine hopes to expand and improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory (canned goods, snacks and beverages)

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is married with 3 children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Merlyn is 41 years old and has 2 children who are in school.

Merlyn has a fishing business in the Philippines. Merlyn requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase fishing gear and equipment.

Merlyn has been in this business for 11 years. She would like to grow and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fishing gear and equipment.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a 30-year-old, married woman with 3 school-age children. Evelyn lives in Gala, Ozamis City.

To earn a living, Evelyn operates a general store. She has operated this business for 5 years. Each month, she earns approximately 3,000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan in the amount of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional products for her general store.

Evelyn has been a member of PMPC for 5 months. In the future, Evelyn hopes to save money to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase additional products for her general store

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
This is Jonalyn, a 29-year-old resident of Tanza, Cavite City, Philippines. Her husband, Sonny, is a painter. They have three children: two are already studying in elementary school while one is still too young for school and stays at home. She, together with her husband and children, manages their household while operating her business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Jonalyn operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which sells groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to residents of the local neighborhood. It is, for example, the place to go to buy shampoo, cooking oil, or an egg. She earns income by purchasing supplies at wholesale prices and selling individual items at retail prices. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 250 PHP in sales every day.

To help her to continue to operate the business, she is requesting a loan in the amount of 10,000 PHP. She would like to utilize the loan proceeds to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products needed for her business. She expects a boost in her business income as a result of the loan because it will enable her to expand her business.

Jonalyn hopes her business will be stable and dreams of being able to provide her children with a high-quality education through all her hard work. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship* members each week to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. *All CCT community partners and clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is comprised of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory (grocery items and other products) needed for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Adel

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 29 years old, married and lives with seven family members; three of them work.

Adel has owned a market since 2007, selling foodstuffs, bulk herbs, spices and medicinal herbs. He has more than four years' experience and he has a deep understanding of local consumers and a good reputation. His market is situated in a crowded area so there are a lot of customers passing by.

He is requesting a $1500 loan in order to purchase a diesel generator and to make a sliding door and outdoor ceiling for his market. He is aiming to earn more profit to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to purchase a diesel generator and to make a  sliding door and an  outdoor ceiling for his market.

loans.name: Rokhila

texts.ru: Рохила трудолюбивая и честная женщина. Она замужем и любящая мать 7 детей. Рохила с 2002 года занимается выращиванием пшеницы, ячмень и лука. Она имеет 10 га посевная земля. Рохила имеет большую и дружную семью. Она хочет улучшить свое жилищное условие и с этой целью она запрашивает займ для покупки стройматериалов для того чтобы отремонтировать свой дом. Она заранее благодарить всех вас за поддержку и помощь.
texts.en: Rokhila is a hard-working and honest woman.  She is married and is a loving mother of seven children.  Since 2002, Rokhila has been involved in growing wheat, barley and onions.  She has 10 hectares of arable land.  Rokhila has a large and friendly family.  She wants to improve her living conditions and is requesting this loan to buy construction materials to repair her house.  She thanks all of you in advance for the support and help.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to repair her house

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
Alejandra is 58 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married.

Alejandra has a shop that sells clothing like shirts, blouses and underwear. She has operated this business for 5 years. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 14,000 PHP to buy additional inventory of clothing to sell.

Alejandra has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Alejandra hopes to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of clothing to sell

loans.name: Zaman

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 22 years old, single and lives with eight family members; four of them work.

Zaman has been an owner of a barber shop since 2004. He has more than seven years' experience and he has a deep understanding of local consumers and he has a good reputation and he is becoming well known in his area.


He decided to apply for a $2400 loan to renovate his shop’s ceiling, doors, and floor. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: To renovate and repair his shop’s ceiling, doors, and floor.

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita is 52 years of age. She is married and has seven children. She was not able to send them all to school due to lack of finances to sustain their need for a good education. Four of her children are already married. To make a living, Clarita involved herself in rice farming together with her spouse. They both plant and harvest rice and in the future, they sell it to traders in the village. They usually earn a yield during the months of May and November. 

This planting season of October, she needs to pay for laborers who helped in transplanting rice seedlings on the farm. This serves as an additional expense for them but they need to hire laborers because they are not capable of performing all the activities on the farm such as sowing, tilling and transplanting rice seedlings. She has an insufficient fund so she is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000.

In the future, she wants to achieve an abundant harvest to save for the college education of three of her children and assure a brighter future for them.

loans.use: to pay for laborers to help transplant the rice seedlings

loans.name: Jaafar

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 47 years old, married and a father of three children.

Jaafar has been an owner of a market since 2005, selling soft drinks, juices, vegetables, cheese and dairy products and household items. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs and he has sufficient experience in this field. His market is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by.

He is requesting a $2700 loan in order to purchase two showcases and to add more foodstuffs. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to purchase two showcases and to add more foodstuffs.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Elsa has a shop where she makes & sells homemade sausage or longganisa. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan of PHP 14,000 to buy raw ingredients for making homemade sausage.

Elsa has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Elsa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making homemade sausage

loans.name: Joseliza

texts.en:
To make a living, Joseliza has been engaged in corn production for eight years. She is also engaged in a business selling different kinds of street food based in her home. She is willing to work hard every single day to lift her family from poor living. 

Joseliza is married to a farmer and has two school-aged children. According to her, through the income generated from her business, she had been able to give daily allowances to her children in school. 

At this time, she is requesting a loan of PHP 30,000 to purchase seeds and fertilizer to sustain her corn production. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand it.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer to sustain her corn production

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has three children. 

Juliet has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 10,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages. 

Juliet has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Juliet hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 31 years old, single and lives with four family members. One of them works.

Mohamad has been an owner of a toy shop since 2008, selling all types of toys and games such as learning toys, riding toys, bikes and gifts. He has more than three years' experience in this field and has a good reputation. His shop is situated in a crowded area where there are a good number of customers passing by.

He is requesting $2400 in order to renovate and redecorate his shop. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to renovate and redecorate his shop.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is from the village of Lalog 1. He is 43 years old and married with two school-aged children. His wife manages her rolling store where she sells different kinds of food. 

Samuel has been engaged in corn production for almost 18 years. He earned approximately 79,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) from his last crop. They worked hard to provide for their needs and give their children a good quality of life and to be able to send them to school. 

Now, he is requesting a loan of 25,000 PHP to purchase seed and fertilizer for his corn production. He hopes that he can get the amount he requested.

loans.use: to purchase seed and fertilizer for his corn production

loans.name: Piv

texts.en:
Agriculture is one of the major business sectors for the Cambodian people, one of whom is Mrs. Piv, 33, who resides in Kompong Speu province. Mrs. Piv is married and has one child who is not yet enrolled in school and is living under her care. 

Mrs. Piv's husband also helps her grow their rice crop. They typically earn around $2.5 US per day to cover household expenses but this main income is not enough for the whole family. Mrs. Piv wants to expand her business and gain more profit to improve her living conditions. Therefore, Mrs. Piv wants to receive a loan in the sum of $600 from HKL and Kiva. She wants to use it to buy a cow for farming as well as for breeding for calves. With the increase in income, Mrs. Piv wishes to send her child to school and fix some parts of her house.

loans.use: to buy a cow for farming as well as for breeding for calves.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Harold

texts.en:
Harold is willing to work hard every single day to give his family a good quality of life. He has devoted himself to rice production for 15 years. He is now 30 years old, married, and has one school-aged child. His wife is in direct sales, where she offers a collection of personal products in their village. They work hard to provide for their needs and to be able to send their child to school. 

Harold is requesting a loan of 40,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to purchase seed, pesticides and fertilizer for his rice production. He hopes to grow his business and harvest more rice to sell.

loans.use: to purchase seed, pesticides and fertilizer for his rice production

loans.name: Jaafar

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 30 years old and married. He lives with his wife and one family member.

Jaafar has been an owner of a bakery since 2010; he produces and sells flour-based food baked in an oven such as bread, cakes, pastries and pies. He has sufficient experience in this field and a good reputation. His bakery is situated in a crowded area where there are a good number of customers passing by.

He is requesting a $1800 loan in order to reconstruct the stone oven for his bakery. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: In order to reconstruct the stone oven for his bakery.

loans.name: Beishekan's Group

texts.en:
Beishekan is the leader of this group. She is 49 and married to a farmer. Two years ago with an initial investment of 8000 soms she purchased apricots for resale. She made good money and since that time she still continues this activity. At the moment her monthly profit is 20000 soms. With the profits gained from the trade Beishekan was able to improve their living conditions and to repair their house. 

She has applied for this loan because she needs money to purchase two tons of applies for resale. In the future she hopes to expand her business, and she plans to increase the number of her cattle.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase apples for resale

loans.name: Sophieng

texts.en:
Sophieng (pictured above), 58, is a widow with two sons and three daughters. One is married and lives outside the family home, two are garment workers and another one assists his mother’s business. Sophieng also has her elderly mother living with her, in the area surrounding Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Sophieng grows small trees such as mango and jackfruit for sale. She is requesting a loan of $1,000 to grow small trees by buying items such as sacks, soil and fertilizer.

loans.use: to purchase sacks, soil and fertilizer.

loans.name: Ma. Lorena

texts.en:
Ma. Lorena is a 36-year-old married woman with 5 children. The oldest child is 14 years old. Ma. Lorena and her husband are both engaged in a fishing business. Her husband operates their fishing boat and is the one who catches fish and also crabs. Ma. Lorena sells his catch at their town's market. According to Ma. Lorena, they earn about 8000 PHP per month from this business.

Ma. Lorena has requested this loan to buy fishing nets, hooks and other materials. Ma. Lorena plans to use their profit to buy house equipment.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, hooks and other fishing materials

loans.name: Necitas

texts.en:
Necitas is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children.
 
Necitas has a shop that makes and sells rugs for the floors and doorsteps. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy pieces of used clothing for making rugs. Necitas has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Necitas hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy pieces of used clothing for making rugs

loans.name: Ut

texts.en:
Mrs. Ut is a 31-year-old married woman living with her humble husband. They have given birth to two children who are living under their care; they are attending school. Mrs. Ut is a borrower who comes from Ornlong Veng district, where she has lived with her husband for many years. She now works as a local construction worker alongside her husband. From this business activity, this couple can earn approximately $5 for each day. 

To upgrade their living and make a better quality of life, this modest couple would like to purchase a motorbike, but they are lacking some money, thus, they are seeking a loan from HKL, a partner with Kiva. They are hoping that this loan will help their family meet happiness and prosperity, and send their children to get a good education and a university degree. 

She and her husband are very thankful to all the kind lenders that help her family. This is the first loan for her with HKL and Kiva partner.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Dolores  Group

texts.en: Dolores is 44 years old and lives in Bangkal, Ozamiz City. She is married and has 4 children. Dolores has a flower pot business, earning approximately PHP 5,000 monthly. She has a requested loan of PHP 6,000 to purchase clay and materials for her business. Dolores has been a member of PMPC for 1 month. In the future, Dolores hopes to expand her business into the neighboring areas of Ozamiz.

loans.use: to purchase clay and materials for her flower pot business

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 19 years of age and single. After he graduated high school, he temporarily delayed his college education due to financial reasons. He spent that time helping his parents with their farming activities to minimize his parents' labor costs. At present, John is very happy because he has been given the chance to continue his studies and is now in college.

With his determination to continue helping his parents even in just a simple way, John decided to continue his hog raising business. He needs to continue this business and gain income to pay his college fees. John is asking for a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy feed for his piglets. He hopes to maintain his business until he finishes his studies.

loans.use: to buy feed for his piglets

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma, 39 years old, is married and has four school-aged children. The family lives in the village where Vilma generates an income through her crop production. Her business serves as a source of income for the family and helps provide for their daily needs.

Vilma is an industrious and cheerful person, which is why she also started up a retail store for additional income. She says it is not easy work to take on this occupation but since she is determined to provide for her children, she does everything to lift her family from poverty.

Vilma is requesting a loan of PHP 25,000 to purchase seeds and fertilizer for her crop production and additional grocery stock for her general store. She hopes that she can get the amount she requests to further develop her business.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer for her farming and additional grocery stock for her general store

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
