Evangeline has been engaged in corn production for 28 years. She also has a business raising hogs, primarily for breeding. Evangeline is willing to work hard every single day to lift her family from poverty.

Evangeline is married and has four children. She says that she has been able to supplement her family's daily needs through the income generated from her business. 

Evangeline is requesting a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase seeds and fertilizer to sustain her corn production. She hopes that she can get the amount she requests to further develop her business

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer to sustain her corn production

loans.name: Thea

texts.en:
Thea is a widow with three sons who are in school. She lives in a village off National Road Two about twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh City. She sells fruits and flowers, which she buys from fellow villagers and transports to sell in the Phnom Penh market. 

Thea hopes to continue her business, so she is asking for another loan of $1,000 to purchase flowers under contract for sale.

loans.use: To purchase flowers to sell

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther, 42 years old, is married and has five children, three of whom are in school. She has operated a business selling maize flour in Yei, South Sudan, for six years.

Esther requested this loan through BRAC, South Sudan, in order to purchase maize flour, cassava flour and groundnuts to sell. She will use the extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more maize flour, cassava flour, and groundnuts to sell

loans.name: Rexy

texts.en:
Rexy, 39 years old, is married to a housewife and blessed with four school-aged children. The family harmoniously lives in Lalog 1, Luna, Isabela. Rexy has been growing corn for almost 10 years. He earned PHP 12,000 at the last cropping.

Rexy is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase farm supplies. He is determined to work hard to supplement his family's daily needs. He hopes that Kiva will continue to give him financial assistance to improve his family's status in life.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Elvina

texts.en: Elvina is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 3 children. Elvina has operated a retail shop for the past 5 years, selling rice and dried fish per kilogram. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy sacks of rice and dried fish to sell. Elvina is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy rice and dried fish to sell

loans.name: Alma

texts.en: Alma is 33 years old and lives in Bangkal, Ozamiz City. She is married and has 2 school-aged children and 1 infant. Alma has a business selling gasoline, earning approximately PHP 4,000 each month. She has a requested a loan to purchase items to use in her business. Alma has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, she hopes that she will not encounter failure in her business.

loans.use: to purchase gasoline

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is from the village of Lalog 1, Luna, Isabela. She is 53 years old, married and has two children. Susana owns and operates a farm, primarily planting and harvesting corn for sale. Susana has been engaged in her business for over 30 years and earned approximately 55,000 PHP for the last cropping

Susana is requesting a loan of 30,000 PHP to purchase seeds, pesticides and fertilizer. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support extended members of her family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, pesticides and fertilizer

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 24 years old, married, and lives with his wife and a family member who works. 

Since 2009 Mohammad has owned a kiosk, making tea, hot drinks, and cold beverages. He got this work from his grandfather and he has sufficient experience. He has a good reputation and his kiosk is situated in a crowded area where there are a lot of customers passing by. 

He is requesting a $2400 loan in order to buy a new kiosk and gas bottles. He aims to make more money to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: In order to buy a new kiosk and gas bottles.

loans.name: Dilbar

texts.ru: Дилбар умная и трудолюбивая женщина. Она вдова и любящая мать одного сына и дочку. Она занимается выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур. Она в основном выращивает пшеницу, который ей принесет хороший доход. Кроме этого бизнеса Дилбар занимается скотоводством. Она хочет расширить свой бизнес и максимизировать свою прибыль.  За полученный прибыль она хочет проводить свадьбу дочки. Она запрашивает займ в размере 1500$ США для покупки минеральных удобрений, семена пшеницы и скота.
texts.en: Dilbar is a smart and hard-working woman.  She is a widow and a loving mother of one son and a daughter.  She is involved in growing agricultural crops.  She primarily grows wheat, which yields her a good income.  Besides this business, Dilbar is also involved in animal husbandry.  She wants to expand her business and maximize her profit.  She wants to use the resulting profit to hold a wedding for her daughter.  Dilbar is requesting a loan in the sum of $1500 for the purchase of mineral fertilizers, wheat seeds and livestock.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers, wheat seeds and livestock

loans.name: Maryrose

texts.en:
Maryrose is 52 years old, married, and has three children. To make a living, she operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Maryrose has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 60,000 PHP when she harvests her raised crops.

According to her, through the income generated from her business she had been able to provide the needs of her family. At this time, she wants to avail herself of a loan for PHP 35,000 to buy farm inputs needed in her crop production. She is hoping that she can get the amount she requested.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs needed for her crop production

loans.name: Karlo Kristoffer

texts.en:
Karlo Kristoffer is 27 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single with 2 children. 

Karlo Kristoffer has a shop that sells fish like sardines and milk fish. He has had this business for 5 years. He requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy fish to sell. Karlo Kristoffer is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Karlo Kristoffer hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Ethel

texts.en:
Ethel is 34 years old and lives in Guba, Ozamiz City. She is married with 3 school-aged children. 

To earn a living, Ethel has a business selling snacks. She earns about PHP 2000 each month doing this type of work. Ethel has requested a loan of PHP 5000 to purchased bananas for her bananacue snacks (deep fried bananas coated in caramelized brown sugar). Ethel has been a member of PMPC for 6 years. In the future, Ethel would like to put up a permanent store in Ozamiz for her business.

loans.use: to purchase bananas

loans.name: Hassna

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is 58 years old, a widow, and a mother to two children who work; they live with six family members. 

Hassna has been a tailor since 1980; she makes, repairs, or alters clothing professionally such as suits, coats, and trousers for women and kids. She has more than twenty years experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knows about their needs. She has a good reputation and she is  well known in the surrounding areas. 

She is requesting a $2000 loan to purchase an industrial sewing machine, a generator, and to add more materials such as buttons, zippers, and thread. She aims to make more money to offer her the opportunity to provide a better life for her family as a whole.

loans.use: To purchase an industrial sewing machine, a generator, and to add more materials as buttons, zippers, and thread.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa, 49 years old, is married and has two school-aged children. The family lives in the village where Elsa raises crops. Her business serves as a source of income for the family and helps provide for their daily needs.

Elsa is an industrious and cheerful person.  She says it is not easy work to take on this occupation, but since she is determined to provide for her children, she does everything to lift her family from poverty.

Elsa is requesting a loan of PHP 30,000 to purchase seeds, pesticides and insecticides for her crop production. She believes that the loan will help her to increase her yields. She is hoping to harvest a large volume of rice and earn a higher income to support her family's needs.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, pesticides and insecticides for her crop production

loans.name: Cicilia

texts.en: Cicilia, 35 years old, is married and has one child who is not in school. She has operated a business selling clothes in Yei, South Sudan, for five years. Cicilia requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan in order to purchase more clothes to sell. She will use the profit to build a concrete house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia, 51 years old, lives in Tuluan, Tambulig, Zamboanga del sur. She is married and blessed with 7 children. Alicia has operated a general store for more than one year. She has requested a loan of PHP 6,000 to purchase more stock for the store.

Alicia has been a member of PAGLAUM MULTI-PURPOSE COOPERATIVE for almost two years, as she started her business. In the future, Alicia hopes that, through the help of PMPC, she can earn a lot in her business, which could help her financial needs.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en: Estrella is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. Estrella has operated a retail shop for 10 years, selling canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages. Estrella is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 5 children. Teresita has operated a shop for 2 years, selling coconuts and bananas. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy bananas and coconuts to sell. Teresita has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy bananas and coconuts to sell

loans.name: Rosemarie Group

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 32 years old and lives in Nangcaan, Rizal. She is married with two children. 

To earn a living, Rosemarie has a business making and selling bread. She earns about PHP 3600 each month doing this type of work. Rosemarie has a requested a loan of 14,000 to purchase 5 sacks of flour and other ingredients for bread-making. Rosemarie has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, Rosemarie would like to save her income for the future of her children.

Rosemarie is the leader of a 2 person group.  Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: To purchase 5 sacks of flour and other ingerdients for breadmaking

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 35 years old, married and a father for five children. 

Ali is a nurse; in 2008 he opened a clinic where he treats ill, injured, and disabled patients. He has sufficient experience in this field and a good reputation. He is well known in the surrounding areas. 

He is requesting an $1800 loan in order to pay the annual rent of his clinic. He aims to make more money to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for his clinic.

loans.name: Thorng

texts.en:
Mrs. Thorng is a hard-working and hopeful woman. She works as a rice cultivator with her husband on the same farmland. Mrs. Thorng has been involved in agriculture and farming rice since 1990; she has learned this skill well from her parents. Besides helping Mrs.Thorng do the farming, her husband takes some time at home to raise poultry such as chickens and ducks, which are bred for eggs and meat for future sale. Together, this couple can earn around $6USD per day to cover the family’s needs. 

Mrs. Thorng has four children. Two of them work in garment factories. In order to make more income for the family, Mrs. Thorng has created a business for her daughter wholesaling and retailing clothes at a market in Phnom Penh. This business is running very well. Now Mrs. Thorng would like to request some funds from Kiva and HKL to buy additional clothes for selling, and with the remainder, she wants to use it to buy some zinc for re-covering their present house. 

Mrs. Thorng hopes that she will be able to secure her family from poverty.

loans.use: to buy additional clothes to sell

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is 35 years old and a married woman with seven children, five of whom are in school. She has a business of selling bananas in Yei, South Sudan. She has been in this business for six years.

Margret requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hopes of expanding her business. She will use the profits to pay for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase more bananas to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase tomato seedlings for planting

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 6 children. Evelyn has operated a shop for 2 years, selling coconuts and bananas. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy coconuts and bananas to sell. Evelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, shen hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy coconuts and bananas to sell

loans.name: Allaoui

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 39 years old, married, and a father to five children, one of whom works. 

Allaoui has owned a shop since 1996, selling spare parts for cars. He has  sufficient experience in this field and a good reputation. He is well known in his area and the surrounding areas. 

He decided to apply for a $2700 loan in order to renovate and redecorate his shop. He aims to make more money to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to renovate and redecorate his shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase flour and rice

loans.name: Anatalia

texts.en:
This is Anatalia, 49, and a resident of Tanza, Cavite City, Philippines. Her husband, John, is a driver and the couple has two children, both in elementary school. Anatalia, her husband and children manage their household while operating the business. Anatalia works hard to continually provide income for the family's everyday expenses.

Anatalia operates a variety store, which, in the Philippines, is basically a small convenience store that retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, PHP 5 worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Anatalia earns an income by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece Her store is located adjacent to her house and her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 250 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, Anatalia is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan, which she will use to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Anatalia hopes her business will be stable and dreams of being able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products

loans.name: Mirasol

texts.en:
Mirasol is a 45-year-old married woman with 7 children. Her husband is a fisherman. Mirasol sells her husband's catch at their town's market and also buys from other fishermen to have more fish to sell. In addition, Mirasol dries fish outside her house and sells them around her neighborhood.

Mirasol has requested this loan to buy an icebox and more fish to sell. Mirasol hopes for their business to grow bigger and to be able to sustain her children's education.

loans.use: to buy an icebox and more fish to sell

loans.name: Barceliza

texts.en:
Barceliza is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children.
 
Barceliza has a shop that sells used clothing or ukay-ukay. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy stocks of used clothing or ukay-ukay to sell.

Barceliza has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Barceliza hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more used clothing (ukay-ukay) to sell

loans.name: Amer

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 49 years old, married, and a father to four children, two of whom work. 

Amer has owned a large electric generator since 2007, leasing electric lines for his area and surroundings. He worked in this field for four years so he has good experience and a good reputation, and is well known in his area. 

He decided to apply for a $3000 loan in order to purchase an engine for the generator. He aims to make more money to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to purchase an engine for his generator.

loans.name: Anie Khemper

texts.en:
Anie Khemper is 24 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children.
 
Anie Khemper has a retail shop that sells fish like mackerel & sardines. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy fish to sell 
.
Anie Khemper is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Anie Khemper hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Wissam

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 22 years old, married and a father of one child. He lives with five family members; two of them work.

Wissam has owned a bookshop since 2008, for imaging, photocopying and stationery items. He has sufficient experience in this field, and a good reputation. His shop is situated in a crowded area where there are a lot customers passing by.

He decided to apply for a $3000 loan in order to purchase a professional video camera. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to purchase a professional video camera.

loans.name: Stalbek's Group

texts.en:
Stalbek is a member of this group. He is 30 and together with his wife, he brings up two sons, both of whom are preschool ages (under seven).  Stalbek works as a driver for a non-profit organization. Fourteen years ago with an initial investment of 500 soms, Stalbek purchased livestock for breeding. Since that time, he has been running a livestock breeding business. At the moment, he is applying for the loan because he needs additional financial funds to purchase hay for his livestock. In the future, Stalbek wants to provide his children with a good education.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase hay for livestock

loans.name: Cesenia

texts.en:
Cesenia is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with one child. 

Cesenia sells fish, like mackerel and milk fish and has been in business for 5 years.  

Cesenia requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more fish to sell.  She is a new member of HSPFI.  Cesenia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Chea, age 41, is married and a father who has lived in Ornlong Veng, Odor Meanchey, Cambodia for a long time. 

Chea strives to provide the best for his family and works hard for them as a rice and banana farmer.  He’s been a farmer for a long time and his wife Phearom works with him. 

They have three lovely children who live under their care; all attend school.  

He lacks fertilizer and his crops are infested with insects.  He requests a loan through HKL to purchase fertilizer and insecticide.  He says that the loan will be very useful for his business. 

Chea and Phearom hope to send their children to study at a high degree so they can get good jobs and have comfortable houses.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and insecticide.

loans.name: Ailas' Group

texts.en:
Meet Ailas (woman with book in photo).  She is one of this group's members.  Alias is married and the mother of four children: three daughters and a son.  Her oldest daughter is 22 years old.  The next to her is age 19.  Her younger daughter is in 6th grade and 13 years old.  Her son finished his studies until 8th grade and started a mobile phone repairing business.  He runs a shop in the market where he can repair any kind of mobile phone.
 
Ailas is a talented lady.  She owns and operates a sewing clothes business at her home.  She receives orders from neighbors. She also offers customers a variety of ready-made clothes that she sells at reasonable prices.
 
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah.  With the loan, Ailas will buy clothes and a sewing machine to expand her business.  She is hopeful that with a new sewing machine and cloth she will double her income.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine & clothes.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children. 

Victoria has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages.  She's been in business for 5 years.  

Victoria requests a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.  She is a new member of HSPFI.  

In the future, Victoria hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en:
Dominga makes a living by raising hogs: a mother pig and piglets in her backyard.  

Her income from selling some of her hogs helped her start up a variety store which gives her a net income of P300 daily. 

Dominga is requests a loan of P13,000 to maintain her hog raising activities.

Dominga is 32 years old businesswoman who aims to improve her business.  She is married and has three school-aged children.  Their family lives happily in the village of La Salette province of Isabela.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pig.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with 2 children. 

Corazon has a retail shop that sells bananas, food seasoning, noodles and salt per packs.  She has had this business for 10 years and requests a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy noodles, salt, foods seasonings and bananas for sell.

Corazon is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy noodles, salt, foods seasonings & bananas for sell.

loans.name: Escovia

texts.en:
Escovia is a 23 year old married woman with two children.  One is in school.  

She has had a business selling fish in South Sudan for five years.

Escovia requests aloan through BRAC to purchase more fish to sell.  She plans to use the extra income to build a house.

loans.use: she want more income to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Adelein Conception

texts.en:
Adelein Conception is from the village of Lalog 1, Luna, Isabela.  She is 39 years old, married and has one school-aged child. 

To make a living, she raises and harvests corn for sale.  Adelein Conception has been in this business for over 12 years and earns approximately 29,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) per month.

Adelein Conception joined ASKI to gain access to financial services, improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.

She is requesting a loan of 30,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers, such as manure.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, such as manure.

loans.name: Felipa

texts.en:
Felipa is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married. 

Felipa has a retail shop that sells snacks, fried fish and other items.  She has had this business for 10 years and requests a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients for snack making that she'll sell.

Felipa is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making viands & snacks for sell.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy's primary source of income comes from selling kitchen items like kettles, basins, pails and glassware in the market near their house. 

She is 44 years old and still single.  Lucy is generating enough income to support her parents needs for medicine, vitamins and to pay other bills at home such as electric and daily meals.  She is the breadwinner of the family.

Lucy is asking for a loan of P5,000 to buy hangers, pails, basins and chairs to sell in her store. 

In the future, Lucy would like to keep growing her business and achieve financial stability.

loans.use: to buy hangers, pail, basins and chairs to sell in her store.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 65 years old. He is a mixed crop farmer. He is married to Rhoda, who is also a farmer. He has been in the farming business for the past 10 years with the monthly income of 10,000 Kenyan shillings, which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his second loan term with KADET LTD after repaying the previous loan successfully. John will use the loan to buy animal feeds and a dairy goat. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will expand the business. His hopes and dreams are to venture into greenhouse farming, which will help him improve the living standards of his family

loans.use: To buy animal feeds and a dairy goat.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 30-year-old married woman with six children, four of whom are in school. She has a business selling charcoal in Yei county, South Sudan. She has been in this business for five years.
Mary requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to enable her to order more charcoal for sale. She will use the extra income from this loan to pay for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is an enterprising 50-year-old businessman. He is married to Grace who is a businesswoman. They are blessed with two children ages 17 and 15. He has been a shoe maker for the past ten years with a monthly income of KES 10,000 which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his 3rd loan with KADET after repaying the previous ones successfully. Michael will use the loan to buy raw materials for making shoes. 

With the anticipated profit from the business he will expand his business. His hopes and dreams are to open a shoe shop and employ some workers who will be making shoes for his shop and later open a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for making shoes

loans.name: Pricila

texts.en:
Pricila is 65 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 1 child. 
Pricila has a retail shop that sells food seasonings, spices & vegetables. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy food seasoning, spices, noodles & vegetables.
Pricila is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Pricila hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy food seasoning, spices, noodles & vegetables

loans.name: Phann

texts.en: Growing agricultural crops is the major economic activity for Cambodian people who live in Ornlong Veng District, Odor Meanchey province, Cambodia. One of them is Mrs. Phann, 55, who has been involved in the agricultural business for ages. She is a hardworking woman, covering her family’s need. Mrs. Phann’s husband has the same business as her, and they are working together on their existing farmland. This humble couple is getting more experience from this business activity. From this sector, they can earn about 5 dollars for each day. They are blessed with three children who are living under their roof, all of whom are attending a local school. Phann and her husband have grown mixed crops on her land such as rice, potatoes, corn and other kinds of beans. They planted two months ago but the crops are not growing well due to the lack of fertilizer and crop plague, thus she has decided to request a loan to buy mineral fertilizers and pesticide to keep her crops growing well in good condition. In the future, Mrs. Phann wants to build a larger house, send all of her children to college to become well-educated people, and wishes to have a plowing machine. She says that this fund is very useful for her business sector. This is her first loan with HKL, a partner of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers and pesticide.

loans.name: Uguloy

texts.ru: Угулой с 1990 года занимается выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур. Она замужем и любящая мать 5 детей. Она имеет 8 гектар землю и в основном там выращивает пшеницу, ячмень и лука. Она хочет улучшить свое жилищное условия, и она хотела бы получить займ для покупки дверь и окна, а также стройматериалов для своего дома. Она заранее благодарить всех вас за вашу доброту и поощрения.
texts.en: Since 1990, Uguloy has been involved in growing agricultural crops.  She is married and is a loving mother of five children.  She has eight hectares of land and primarily grows wheat, barley and onions there.  She wants to improve her living conditions and wants to obtain a loan to buy a door and windows and also construction materials for her house.  Uguloy thanks all of you in advance for your kindness and support.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Mireille C. G.

texts.fr: Mireille est mariée et mère d'un seul enfant qui est scolarisé et qui évolue dans ses études. Les charges du ménage sont partagées par le couple. Mireille est vendeuse de produits alimentaires, des tissus, des boissons en canettes et autres articles. Sa boutique est située dans une zone très favorable à son activité. La plupart de ses clients sont constitués des habitants de sa zone commerciale et de ses environs. Elle s’approvisionne dans les marchés de Cotonou. Le présent micro crédit est sollicité et obtenu dans le but de mieux répondre aux besoins de sa clientèle. Une partie du revenu supplémentaire généré par ce micro crédit sera réinvesti dans l'activité pour son renforcement et le reste lui permettra de se prendre en charge et d'aider aussi ses parents.
texts.en:
Mireille is married and the mother of one child, who successfully attends school. The household expenses are shared by the parents. Mireille sells food products, cloths, canned beverages and some other groceries. The location of her store is very favorable to her customers, who live in the neighborhood of her store or nearby. Mireille gets her supplies at the markets in Cotonou.

She applied for this microloan and it was granted to her in order to better meet the demand of her clientele. Part of the additional profit generated thanks to this loan will be reinvested in her activity and the amount left over will enable her to take care of her parents and provide for their needs.

loans.use: to buy 50 boxes of canned drinks.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
"Behind the clouds, the sun is still shining," says Rowena as she sees hope behind all hardships in life that her family is experiencing nowadays. She is already married but she has no children yet. Having a big family is what she dreams of. So far, the couple is focused on improving their businesses.They happily lives in the peaceful village of La Salette. 

She is engaged in hog raising. The profit earned from selling grown-up hogs made it possible for her to build her new variety store, which she now manages. Her husband is in full support of her businesses and they hope that they will be able to further expand those. 

Rowena is requesting a loan of 18,000 Philippine pesos for the growth of her businesses buying feed, vitamins and grocery items. This amount will be of big benefit especially to her general store, which is starting to grow. She hopes that her loan will be granted.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and grocery items

loans.name: Pascual

texts.en:
Pascual is a 57-year-old from Trinidad, Bohol. He has an 18-year-old child.

Pascual is a farmer. He primarily grows rice crops to sell. Pascual also runs a small sari-sari store business and sells fish to the people in his community. Pascual does all these to improve his family's living conditions. He requested this loan to purchase fertilizer, fish to sell and more items to sell at his store. Pascual hopes to sustain his child's education, improve his businesses, and renovate their house.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, fish to sell and more items to sell at his store

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Mrs. Sok is 54 years old and married with eight children. Three of them are alreaD. married and live separately, and the other five children are single and have various kinds of jobs. Mrs. Sok earns a living by cultivating rice crop and her husband works as an angler on the sea. In the rainy season this year, she is extremely busy with farming. From this business, she normally earns an average of $3 USD per day. However, the main income comes from her children who are working outdoors. Mrs. Sok is requesting a loan from Kiva to buy grill net and other fishing materials needed for her husband to use on the sea. In the future, Mrs. Sok wishes to expand her business and enlarge her old house for a comfortable living.

loans.use: to buy grill net and other fishing materials.

loans.name: Pandaleon

texts.en:
Pandaleon is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with three children. 

Pandaleon has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. He has had this business for five years. He requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Pandaleon is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Pandaleon hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Justin

texts.en:
Justin is a 43-year-old man. He is a charcoal dealer. He has been operating this business for the last two years. This marks Justin’s second borrowing from KADET, and with this loan he plans to purchase more bags of charcoal for re-sale. 

The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and gradually expand his business. In the future, he would like to own a retail shop.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of charcoal for re-sale

loans.name: Severina

texts.en:
Severina had been selling dressed chicken for almost six years. She usually sells it to the people in the village where she lives together with her parents. She is 42 years old and still single. She is generating income to provide sustenance for her family.

She is now requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy chickens to dress and sell. 

She would like to diversify her business and earn enough income to save for future emergencies, especially since her parents are getting weak and old.

loans.use: to buy chickens to dress and sell

loans.name: Warlito

texts.en:
Warlito is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 12 children. 

Warlito has an upholstery shop that repairs sofa beds & chairs. He has had this business for 10 years. He requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy tools & materials needed for the upholstery shop.

Warlito is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Warlito hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools & materials for his upholstery shop

loans.name: Sakina's Group

texts.en:
Sakina is married and a mother of three children: one daughter and two sons. Her elder son operates a small restaurant where he sells a Punjabi food item, "Nan Chany" (made with chickpeas and served with bread and pickles), to his customers. His food item is very famous among them and they come to him daily. He contributes to his family financially from his earnings.
 
Her daughter is 17 years old and does sewing & embroidery at home. She doesn’t use her skill as a profession and do it to pass the time.  

Sakina has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to expand her son’s restaurant business. With the loan, he will buy required ingredients like cooking oil, spices, flour, chickpeas and pickles to make good quality food to serve to his customers and increase his profits. 

She is hopeful that her son’s business will be improved further after the loan and that her family will be able to enjoy better facilities of life as a result.

loans.use: To buy ingredients to make Nan Chany to sell

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is 23 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Remedios has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Remedios is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Remedios hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 42 years old, and mother to five children. She is a green grocer, and has been in the business for the past two years. She gets a monthly income of KES 5,000 from the business.

This is her first loan from KADET LTD. She will use the loan to buy onions, tomatoes, and greens for stock for the business.

She will use anticipated profits to educate her children and also expand the business. Her hopes and dreams are to own a big business that can sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy onions, tomatoes, and green vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Damira's Group

texts.en:
Damira is the leader of this group. She is 43 and married to a constructor. Together with her husband, she brings up a son and two daughters, all the children study at school. Two years ago with an initial investment of 15000 soms, Damira purchased cattle for breeding. She started this activity in order to earn additional money to meet the family needs. She earns additional 2000 soms per month by selling milk products. In case she needs money, she can sell some animals. At the moment Damira needs additional funds to purchase hay for cattle.  She applies for the loan for this purpose. In the future, she wishes to save money to purchase a vehicle for her son.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase hay for cattle.

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en:
Esmeralda is 43 years old, and lives in the Philippines. She is separated with three children. 
Esmeralda has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.
Esmeralda is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Esmeralda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Im

texts.en: This borrower comes from Kompong Speu Province, Cambodia. Mrs. Im has been spending all of her life cultivating crops. This is a skill she had learned from her parents when she was young. Im has been in the farming business since 1979. Im is married to Mr. Thol who generates income alongside her. From this business activity, Im can earn about $1USD per day. This humble couple has given birth to four kids who are all singles. To assist her income, three of her children are employed as garment factory workers in Phnom Penh city where they can get enough salary for each month; another is attending school. To upgrade their living condition, Im wishes to have a motorbike to facilitate her son’s traveling, but lacks cash, so she has decided with her husband to apply for a loan through HKL, a partner of Kiva. She hopes that this loan will make her family meet happiness and prosperity all the time. This is her first loan with HKL. She is very thankful to all kind lenders that help her family. She is shown with her husband in this photo.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Nestor

texts.en:
With the passion to see his children become professionals someday, Nestor strives to work in order to give his children the great opportunity of sending  them to school to finish their education. Nestor is 47 years old and is married. He has three school-aged children.
Nestor has been a farmer in the Philippines for over 20 years. Aside from farming, Nestor engages himself in a hog-raising business, primarily hogs for fattening. Nestor just started this business for an additional source of income for the family. He has experienced difficulties in financing his family needs, that’s why he strives to work, and doesn’t want to again experience a financial shortage.
Nestor wants to borrow a loan amounting P25,000 to purchase feed for the maintenance of his hogs. He hopes to maintain, and expand the business while he operates it.

loans.use: to purchase feed for the maintenance of his hogs.

loans.name: Maribeth

texts.en: Maribeth is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has two children. Maribeth has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages. Maribeth is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Maribeth hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Djogbe

texts.fr: Rafiatou est mariée et a à charge 2 enfants, tous scolarisés. Elle vit en couple avec ses enfants. Son époux est agent comptable dans une société de la place. Les charges familiales reviennent au couple. Rafiatou est coiffeuse de formation, fonction qu'elle exerce présentement. A cela, elle a associé la vente des mèches, des produits cosmétiques, des sacs, des chaussures, des pagnes et autres articles qu'elle vend a une clientèle diversifiée et variée. Ses approvisionnements se font auprès des grossistes de la place. La cliente souhaiterait que son commerce connaisse une parfaite évolution, raison pour laquelle elle a sollicité et obtenu à FINADEV son 1er microcrédit afin de jouir d'une autonomie financière susceptible de l’aider à augmenter le volume de son stock pour une meilleure satisfaction des attentes de ses clients. Le revenu supplémentaire généré par ce micro crédit lui permettra de faire face à ses charges personnelles et de contribuer à l'épanouissement de sa famille.
texts.en: Rafiatou is married and has two children in her care, both attending school. She lives with her husband and the children. Her husband is an accountant in a local company. Household expenses are shared by the parents. Rafiatou is a trained hairdresser and currently works in her profession. In addition, she sells hair extensions, cosmetics, handbags, shoes, pagnes (colorful West African cloths) and a few other articles to a diversified clientele. She gets her supplies from local wholesalers. Rafiatou would like to see her business in steady expansion. Therefore she came to the microfinance institution Finadev and applied for her first microloan. The loan was granted and it will enable her to become financially self-sufficient and to expand her inventory and thus better meet the expectations of her customers. The additional income that she expects thanks to this microloan will enable her to provide for her personal needs and contribute to her family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy 25 units of Hitarget cloth.

loans.name: Nestor

texts.en:
This is Nestor, age 45, who is a resident of Tanza, Cavite, in the Philippines. He is married to Rufina, a housewife and mother to their three children. Nestor, together with his wife, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Nestor operates a market stall. He sells meat and vegetable products in the community market. He buys quantities of meat, fish and vegetables, and sells them per kilo. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of Php1000 in sales every day.

To help him continue to operate his business, Nestor is requesting a Php 12,000 loan. He will utilize the loan to buy more quantities of meat and vegetables to expand his product inventory. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business. 

Nestor hopes to be able to expand soon and buy a motorcycle for his business. He hopes to support his children's schooling up to the college level. He faithfully meets with his co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of his work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stock of meat and vegetables needed in his business.

loans.name: Abdukodir

texts.ru: Абдукодир занимается выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур. Он женат и ответственный отец 2 детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Абдукодир с 2000 года заиается выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур. Он в основном выращивает лук, ячмень и пшеницу. Более 10 лет он занимается этим бизнесом. Абдукодир хотел бы получить займ для покупки строительных материалов для ремонта своего дома. Он заранее благодарить всех вас за вашу доброту и помощь.
texts.en: Abdukodir is involved in growing agricultural crops.  He is married and is a responsible father of two children.  His wife is a homemaker.  Since 2000, Abdukodir has been involved in growing agricultural crops.  He primarily grows onions, barley and wheat.  He has been in this business for over 10 years.  Abdukodir wants to obtain this loan for the purchase of construction materials to repair his house.  He thanks all of you in advance for your kindness and help.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina is 29 years old. She lives with her parents in the village of Pinto Alfonso Lista in the Philippines.

Christina engages in retailing to earn a living. She has had this business for six years. It was her field of interest even when she was still young and single. Christina has a good way of tending to and treating her customers, and for this reason they prefer to buy in her store. Before she goes to her store, she feeds her four raised piglets. She is grateful because she is able to operate her business well. 

Christina would like to request additional capital in the amount of P7,000 to buy stock of groceries and feed for her hog-raising business. As her business grows, she wants to have as many products as possible so she can offer her customers more variety and satisfy their demands. Through the amount she requests, she will be able to improve the quality of life for herself and her entire family.

loans.use: to buy stock of groceries and feed for her hog-raising business.

loans.name: Amer

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 48 years old, married and father of two children.

A. has been an owner of a bakery since 2004; he produces and sells flour-based food baked in an oven such as bread, cakes, pastries and pies. He has  sufficient experience in this field and a good reputation. His bakery is situated in a crowded area where there are a good number of customers passing by.

He is requesting a $3000 loan in order to pay the annual rent for his bakery. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for his bakery.

loans.name: Jurenda

texts.en: Jurenda is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has seven children. Jurenda has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages. Jurenda is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Jurenda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Abel

texts.en: Abel is a 32-year-old married man with five children. He lives in his permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is married to a cashier, and their dream is to educate their children. For two years, he has operated a driving school, contending with the challenge of high fuel prices. In spite of this, he hopes to own at least five cars since the enrollment is increasing steadily. Abel needs the loan facility to buy a car for his driving school.

loans.use: to buy a car for his driving school.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac is 48 years old. He is married to Lucy, a farmer, and together they have three children. Isaac owns a workshop and has been in the business for the past 17 years. He gets a monthly income of KES 31,500 from the business.

This is Isaac's third loan from KADET LTD. He paid his previous loan successfully. He will use the loan amount to purchase a machine for use in the workshop. 

He will use the extra profit to open another outlet. His dream is to educate his children to the university level.

loans.use: to purchase a machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more livestock.

loans.name: Jabbar

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 33 years old, married and father of two children.

Jabbar has owned a shop since 2007, selling mobile phones, accessories and rechargeable cards. He has a deep understanding of local customers and knows about their needs. He has a good reputation and he is becoming well-known in the surrounding areas.


He decided to apply for a $2900 loan in order to pay the annual rent and to add more merchandise. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: In order to pay the annual rent and to add more goods.

loans.name: Melitona

texts.en: Melitona is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. Melitona has a tailoring shop that makes and sells wedding gowns, uniforms and dresses for special occasions. She has had this business for 20 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy raw materials like fabric and needles. Melitona is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Melitona hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials like fabric and needles.

loans.name: Aizada

texts.en:
Aizada, age 19, is a resident of a small town in Kyrgyzstan called Kemin. She works as a bookkeeper in a bank. A year ago, she saved 15000 soms and with that money she purchased a calf for breeding. She chose a cattle-breeding business because she thinks it is the best and most effective way to invest money. When cattle grow up and their weight increases, the price for cattle increases, too. With the money received from the loan, Aizada wants to purchase more farm animals for breeding. In the future, she wishes to save money to purchase a car of a red color.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – people (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our lending team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase more farm animals for breeding.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is 42 years old and is a single mother of two children. She sells cloth materials, and she has been in this business for the last two years. 

Lilian was recently introduced to KADET LTD, and this marks her first borrowing to finance her business. Her business is doing well and with this loan she plans to add more stock of cloth materials to her business. 

The anticipated profits that will be generated from the business will be directed into the repayment of the loan and the gradual expansion of her business. Her dream is to become a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: to add more stock of cloth materials.

loans.name: Raed

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 38 years old, married and a father of two children.

Raed has been an owner of a bookshop since 2004, selling books, office supplies and stationery. He has a deep understanding of local customers and knows about their needs. He has a good reputation and he is becoming well-known in the surrounding area.

He is requesting a $3000 loan in order to pay the annual rent and to purchase additional inventory. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent and to purchase additional inventory.

loans.name: Liberato

texts.en:
This is Liberato, 37, resident of Tanza, Cavite, Philippines. He is married to Daisy, a housewife and mother to their four children. Liberato, together with his wife, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Liberato operates a tailoring business. He mainly offers office uniforms, pants, shorts, and the like. Seasonal demands for clothing like school uniforms are available all year round. He also does repairs and alterations. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community.  He earns a minimum of Php3,750 in sales every week.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a Php 10,000 loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread and other items needed in his business. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business. 

Liberato hopes to be able to expand soon and hopes to support his children's schooling up to college level. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw materials needed in his business.

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.en:
Candelaria is 64 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 8 children. She has a food shop that sells bananas & viands like pancit bihon, afritada & halang-halang. She has had this business for 15 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients for making snacks & viands for selling.

Candelaria is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future,she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making snacks and meals for selling.

loans.name: Haydar

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 41 years old, married and a father of five children.

Haydar has owned a food market since 2010, selling soft drinks, juices, vegetables, cheese and dairy products and household items. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs; he has sufficient experience in this field. His market is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by.

He decided to apply for $3000 in order to renovate his market’s floor and walls and to add more foodstuffs. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to renovate his market’s floor and walls and to add more foodstuffs.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 54 years old and married with three school aged children. He is a farmer. He plants corn in the Philippines. His wife is a housekeeper and his partner in caring for their family. Emmanuel’s wife plants and harvests various vegetables that serve them as an alternative source of income for the family.

To further cover their family's needs, especially his children's needs in school, Emmanuel decided to start up another source of income that he believes will be a great help for his family to improve their living situation. Now, Emmanuel runs a hog raising business. Due to a financial shortage, he cannot buy the full amount of feed needed for the maintenance of his hogs. This will affect their growing and weight.

Emmanuel is requesting a loan of P22,000 to buy stocks of feed for the maintenance of his hogs. The loan will be a big help for him because he is able to buy sacks of feed in the market. It will minimize his fare expense of going to the market.

loans.use: to buy stocks of feed for the maintenance of his hogs.

loans.name: Arzymat

texts.en:
Arzymat is a resident of Kemin. He is 55 and together with his wife, who works in a pharmacy, he has raised three children. All the children are married and have their own families and live independently from their parents. 

Arzymat works as a bus driver, and in order to earn additional money to meet their daily needs, he breeds cattle. He started this activity ten years ago with an initial investment of 12,000 soms. With that money he purchased a calf and since that time he has been breeding cattle. He resells cattle after fattening, and in this way he earns about 15,000 soms in half a year. 

With money received from the loan he wants to purchase more cattle for breeding, fattening and further reselling. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Keo

texts.en:
Growing agricultural crops is the main economic sector of Cambodian people who live in Ornlong Veng District, Odor Meanchey province, Cambodia. One of them is Mrs. Keo, 49, who has been involved in an agricultural business for ages. She is a hardworking woman covering her family’s needs. Keo’s husband also has the same business as her, and they are working together on their existing farmland. This humble couple is getting more experience from this business activity. From this sector, they can earn about 3 dollars for each dA.. 

They are blessed with four children, one of whom has already married and is living in a new home, and the other three of them are living under Keo's care. To assist her income, two of her daughters are employed as sewing factory workers in Phnom Penh city where they can earn enough salary for each month. 

To promote a family living a better quality of life, Keo has decided with her husband to apply for a loan in the amount of $1,200 with the purpose of purchasing a motorbike. She is expecting that this loan will make her family meet happiness and prosperity. This is her second loan with HKL, and the first of her loans with a Kiva partner. She is in the photo with her lovely husband.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Dourgham

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 22 years old, single and lives with five family members of whom three work.

Dourgham has owned a barber shop since 2008. He has experience in this field and he has a deep understanding of local consumers and a good reputation. He is well known in his area.

He decided to apply for a $2,400 loan to pay the annual rent for his shop. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: To pay the annual rent for his shop.

loans.name: Ereneo

texts.en:
Ereneo is 50 years old and is a resident of Tanza, Cavite, Philippines. He is married to Jocelyn, who is a housewife and mother to their children. Ereneo, together with his wife, manages his household while operating his business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Ereneo operates a van rental business. He has one van that may be rented for transportation service or for people who need a van for out-of-town service. Ereneo provides his services within the city and nearby provinces. He also sells ready-to-wear products to earn additional income. Ereno’s regular customers are neighbors and the local community.  He earns a weekly minimum of 4,000 PHP in sales every week.

Ereneo is requesting an 11,000 PHP loan to buy spare parts and maintain his van to help him continue to operate his business. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands. In the future, Ereneo hopes to buy another van and support his children’s education through college. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share weekly stories of his work and to draw strength and inspiration from his studies of the Word of God. 


* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and maintain his van

loans.name: Fridah

texts.en:
Fridah is 19 years old and is not married. She supports a family of ten members. For the past three years, she has been a farmer and she earns a monthly income of 15,000 KES.

Fridah is requesting a 10,000 KES loan to purchase seed and fertilizer for her farm. This will be her first loan with KADET LTD.  Fridah will use her anticipated profit to expand and improve her business. Her hopes and dreams for the future are to be a successful farmer and uplift her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Anaam

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is 40 years old, married and the mother of five children.

Anaam is a tailor in a factory for men’s clothing. In 2005 she decided to also work in her house after her main work time, making, repairing, or altering  suits, coats and trousers for women. She has more than five years experience in this field. She understands local customers and knows about their needs. She has a good reputation and she is well known in the area.

She is requesting a $2,600 loan in order to purchase a new tailoring machine and an electric power generator and to repair the walls of her workplace. 

She is aiming to gain more profits to improve her family’s life.

loans.use: to purchase a new tailoring machine and an electric power generator and to repair the walls of her workplace.

loans.name: Dinara

texts.en:
Dinara is 44 years old and is married to a security guard. Together with her husband she has raised three children, all of whom are married and have their own families. In order to earn money to meet her daily needs, Dinara breeds livestock. She started her business eleven years ago with an initial investment of 15,000 KGS that she used to purchase three sheep that she resold at a higher price.  Her current monthly profit from her business is about 3,000 KGS. 

Dinara is requesting a loan to purchase more livestock to breed, fatten, and resell. She will also use a part of her loan to organize an anniversary celebration of her wedding. In the future, she plans to build a livestock shed. 


--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 28 years old single. For the past four years, he has been a livestock trader in the busy market of Bissil where most of his clients are men. Joseph earns a monthly income of 10,000 KES. He was introduced to KADET LTD by a staff member. He has a good credit history and is very organized and honest.

Joseph is applying for his second loan of 80,000 KES to buy livestock and to pay fees for evening classes that he is taking. He will use his anticipated profit to start a butcher shop. Joseph hopes to become a prominent businessperson in Bissil.

loans.use: to buy livestock and pay school fees

loans.name: Majed

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 44 years old, married and the father of five children.

Majed is a veterinarian. In 1991 he opened his own veterinary clinic. He treats animals and sells medications and pharmaceuticals. He has experience in this field and a good reputation. He is well known in his area and the surroundings.

He decided to apply for a $2,400 loan in order to pay the annual rent for his clinic. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for his clinic.

loans.name: Riyad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 42 years old, married and the father of five children.

Riyad has owned a shop since 2000, selling mobile phones, accessories and rechargeable cards. He has experience in this field and a good reputation. He is well known in his area and the surroundings.

He decided to apply for a $1,800 loan in order to pay the annual rent for his shop. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for his shop.

loans.name: Janelyne

texts.en:
This borrower is Janelyne from Pinto Alfonso Lista, Ifugao. She is 31 years old, married, and has one child. For the past five years, Janelyne has owned a restaurant where she prepares menus such as vegetable, chicken, and pork dishes. Her restaurant is located in a crowded area with a good number of passersby and she employs one cook. Janelyne's profit goes to her family’s household expenses.

Janelyne is requesting a 7,000 PHP loan to purchase ingredients such as meat and vegetables and soft drinks for her restaurant. She will improve her production capacity and increase her sales. Janelyne is hoping to increase her profits and provide a better life for her family.

loans.use: purchase ingredients to prepare food for her restaurant

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more goats, wheat flour, and washing detergents

loans.name: Ikhlass

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is 36 years old, married and the mother of three children.

Ikhlass is a tailor. She started working in 2000. She makes, repairs or alters suits, coats and trousers for women. She has more than ten years experience in this field. She understands local customers and knows about their needs. She has a good reputation and she is well known in the surrounding areas.

She decided to apply for a $2,400 loan in order to purchase a tailoring machine and to renovate and redecorate her workplace. She is aiming to gain more profits to improve her family’s life.

loans.use: to purchase a tailoring machine and to renovate and redecorate her workplace.

loans.name: Wensira

texts.fr: Mariée et sans enfants, Wensira vit avec son mari en location. Les dépenses familiales reviennent au mari mais elle y participe dans une certaine proportion. Wensira mène son activité génératrice de revenu dans une boutique située dans la ville de Cotonou. Elle commercialise des conserves, des liqueurs, des boissons en cannette, des pagnes, des produits cosmétiques et autres. Sa clientèle, diverse et variée est constituée des habitants de sa zone et de ses environs. Elle effectue ses approvisionnement chez les grossistes du Bénin. Pour éviter les ruptures de stocks, Wensira a sollicité et obtenu un concours financier à FINADEV, ce qui lui permet de mieux achalander sa boutique, d'avoir du stock disponible en permanence afin de combler les attentes de sa clientèle. Elle espère tirer un revenu supplémentaire qui l'aidera à assurer son bien-être et celui de ses proches.
texts.en:
Wensira is married without children; she lives in rented accommodation with her husband. Her husband covers the family expenses but she contributes to some extent. 

She conducts her income generating activity in a shop located in the town of Cotonou. She sells canned goods, liquor, canned drinks, “pagnes”, cosmetic products and more. Her diverse and varied customer base is made up of the residents of her area and its surroundings. She gets her supplies from wholesalers in Benin.

To avoid a shortage of supplies, Wensira requested and obtained the financial help of FINADEV. This will allow her to better stock up her shop, to have a constant available supply in order to better meet her customers' demand. She hopes to make an additional income that will help her ensure her well-being and the one of those close to her.

loans.use: to purchase 20 boxes of milk

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty will use this loan to buy hair treatments and chemicals for her business and will use the rest to pay school fees for her child in college. She is 41 years old, married to David, and together they have three children who are all going to school. She owns a salon and has been in the business for the past two years. She makes a monthly income of 9,000 Kenyan shillings from the business. This is her second loan from KADET Ltd. Anticipated profits will be used to support the family's financial budget and also to pay school fees for the children. Her dream is to see all her children educated to university level.

loans.use: to buy hair treatments and hair chemicals

loans.name: Khuon's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Khuon is a 47-year-old married woman and the mother of two children. She was chosen to be the group leader of this solidarity group loan, which consists of three members. All of them live and work as rice farmers in Kompong Chhnang province. Mrs. Khoun’s husband is a fisherman who fishes in local river and ponds and sells his catch to tradesmen who come to collect the fish every day.
 
Mrs. Khoun is requesting a loan from Kiva to purchase a fishing boat for her husband. She hopes to use her increased profit to educate her children in professional schools. 

Mrs. Krorn, another group member, is also requesting funds to purchase a fishing boat for her husband.

The other group member, Mrs. Sourng, is a single woman. Along with farming, she also raises pigs at home. She is requesting a loan to buy piglets to raise. 

Mrs. Khoun’s group is grateful in advance to Kiva and its lenders for their kindness.

loans.use: to purchase a fishing boat

loans.name: Riyadh

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 33 years old, married and the father of one child.

Riyadh has owned a workshop since 2009 for manufacturing molds to make concrete roofs and floors. He has more than 15 years experience from his previous work with his father and grandfather. He has a good reputation and he is well known in his area.

He is requesting a $3,000 loan purchase equipment for making molds. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to purchase equipment for making molds.

loans.name: Geswendebala De Sect15 Group

texts.fr:
Mme GISELE est la représentante du groupe GESWENDBALA DE SECT 15. Elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants. Le plus âgé a 19ans et le moins âgé a 02mois. 03 de ses enfants vont à l’école. Elle a 11 personnes en charge.

Elle vend des pagnes depuis 05ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché du secteur 10 en ville. Ses clients sont les agents des différents services et ses voisins.

Elle veut s’acheter 20 complets pagnes.

Mme veut utiliser ses bénéfices pour ouvrir un compte d’épargne. Elle ambitionne ouvrir une boutique pour ses pagnes et aider son mari dans la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en: Gisele is the representative of the "Geswendbala de Sect 15" group. She is married and the mother of five children. The oldest is 19 years old and the youngest is two months. Three of her children are in school. She has 11 people dependent on her. She has sold pagnes [colorful cloths] for five years. She stocks up at the market in sector 10 of the city. Her customers are purveyors of other services and her neighbors. She would like to buy 20 full pagnes. She would like to use her profits to open a savings account. Her goal is to open a store to sell her pagnes and to help her husband pay for their children's education.

loans.use: to purchase 20 full pagnes

loans.name: Vakhobchon

texts.ru: Вахобчон занимается выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур. Он женат и у него 1 ребенок. Он выращивает картошку и пшеницу. В этом бизнесе ему помогает его жена  и они вместе дружно работает. Он хочет расширить свой бизнес и максимизировать свою прибыль. За полученный доход он хочет построит дом. Вахобчон запрашивает займ для в размере 7000 Сомони  для покупки семена, горюче смазочные материалы и скота.
texts.en: Vakhobchon is involved in growing agricultural crops.  He is married and has one child.  He grows potatoes and wheat.  His wife helps him in this business, and they work well together.  Vakhobchon wants to expand his business and maximize his profit.  He wants to use the resulting profit to build a house.  Vakhobchon is requesting a loan in the sum of 7000 Somoni to buy seeds, fuel-lubricant materials and livestock.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fuel-lubricant materials and livestock

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 24 years old, married and has two children.

Ali has owned a shop selling and repairing motorcycles and spare parts since 2004. He has more than seven years experience in this field and a good reputation. He is well known in his area.

He decided to apply for a $3,000 loan in order to pay the annual rent for his shop and to add more inventory. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for his shop and to add more inventory.

loans.name: Jassem

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 32 years old, married and the father of four children. 

J. has owned a store since 2007, selling construction materials and electrical materials. He has experience in this field through his study of electricity. He has a good reputation and he is well known in the surrounding areas.

He decided to apply for a $3,000 loan in order to make showcases, to renovate his store’s walls and floors and to add more inventory. He is aiming to gain more profits to improve his family’s life.
