loans.use: to make showcases, to renovate his store’s walls and floors and to add more inventory.

loans.name: Khurshed

texts.ru: Хуршед житель района Дж. Руми. Ему 35 лет. Он женат. У него трое детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам он занимается торговлей в торговом центре. Арендует помещение, где открыл магазин бытовой техники. В этой области он уже семь лет. Кредит берет для приобретения телевизоров, параболических тарелок и необходимой бытовой техники.
texts.en: Khurshed lives in the J.Rumy district.  He is 35 years old, married and has three children.  His wife is a homemaker.  Khurshed is involved in retail sales at a shopping center.  He leases a space, where he opened a household electronics store.  He has been in this field for seven years.  Khurshed is requesting this loan for the purchase of televisions, parabolic dishes and necessary household electronics.

loans.use: to purchase televisions, parabolic dishes and necessary household electronics

loans.name: Mahbuba's Group

texts.en:
Mahbuba is the leader of this group. She is 44 years old and married to a farmer. Together with her husband, she is raising two daughters, both of whom study at school. Four years ago, Mahbuba used an initial investment of 30,000 KGS to start a business selling spare parts. She has achieved good results in the past four years and has been able to build a small store and increase her business sales. She currently earns 8,000 KGS profit each month. 

Mahbuba is requesting a loan to purchase more spare parts and improve the assortment of goods that she sells. In the future, she plans to purchase a container.


--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts

loans.name: Makhtozh

texts.ru: Махтож ответственная, трудолюбивая женщина. Она швея со стажем. Вот  уже 11 лет она занимается этой деятельностью. Махтож реставрирует пальто, плащи, халаты, брюки и другую верхнюю одежду. Она не замужем и все свое свободное время проводит на  работе. Махтож честно выполняет свою работу, поэтому у нее много клиентов. Она хочет обслуживать как можно больше клиентов, но для этого ей нужна еще другая швейная машина с другими операциями, но нужной суммы у нее нет. Махтож обратилась к вам за поддержкой и надеется, что вы ей не откажете.
texts.en: Makhtozh is a responsible and hard-working woman.  She is a seamstress with experience.  She has been in this business for 11 years.  Makhtozh restores coats, raincoats, robes, pants and other outerwear.  She is not married and spends all of her free time at work.  Makhtozh does her work honestly, and this is why she has many clients.  She wants to have as many customers as possible, but to meet this goal, she needs another sewing machine with different functions and does not have the necessary funds to buy it.  Makhtozh came to you for the support and hopes that you will not reject her request.

loans.use: to purchase another sewing machine

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is a responsible mother who helps her husband to manage a rice farming business to support their family’s needs. She is 48 years old and has three school-age children. Due to financial difficulties, Daisy and her husband cannot afford to finance the schooling of their children who are all at the college level. Daisy and her husband aim to increase their yields and income to support education of their children.

Daisy is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide and to pay the labor costs required to plant rice. She hopes that through their patience and hard work, she and her husband will increase their yield and income this harvest season. In the future, they are hoping that their children will earn college degrees and have a better life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide and to pay labor costs

loans.name: Tchédjou

texts.fr: Mariée et ayant 2 enfants, Tchédjou vit avec son mari et leurs enfants, tous scolarisés. Les dépenses familiales sont assurées par son mari. Tchédjou est coiffeuse de profession. Parallèlement, elle y a associé la vente des produits cosmétiques, des mèches, des pagnes et autres, à une clientèle composée essentiellement des habitants de sa zone et de ses environs. Elle effectue ses approvisionnements dans les boutiques des grossistes de Cotonou, la capitale économique du Bénin. Après quelques ventes, Tchédjou constate qu'elle n'est plus en mesure de satisfaire les demandes d'autres clients, raison pour laquelle elle s'est rapprochée de FINADEV afin d'augmenter sa capacité d'approvisionnement. Elle a obtenu un micro crédit à FINADEV;le revenu supplémentaire généré par ce prêt lui permettra de faire face aux charges du foyer et d'améliorer la condition de vie sociale et économique de l'ensemble.
texts.en:
Tchédjou is married and has two school-attending children. She lives with her husband and her children. Her husband takes care of the family expenses. 

She's a professional hairdresser, and also sells cosmetics, hair extensions, pagnes (colorful African cloth), and other items, to a clientele comprising mostly people from the area where she lives.

Tchédjou gets her supplies from wholesalers in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. After realizing some sales, she noticed that she's not able to meet customer demand anymore. This is why she contacted Kiva's partner, FINADEV, in order to bolster her purchasing capacity.

She's seeking a loan from FINADEV, whose additional income will help her pay the expenses of her household and improve its social and economic standard of living.

loans.use: to buy 30 dozen of hair extensions

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a 39-year-old lady who is married and has one child. Her husband supports their family with profits from his work as a rice farmer. For the past three years, Evelyn has run a home-based store where she sells groceries. She started her business with the investment of her own small capital. 

Evelyn is requesting a 7,000 PHP loan to purchase groceries such as soft drinks, bread, cooking oil, canned goods, shampoo, detergent and other items. Evelyn is confident that her loan will generate more income and that she’ll be able to provide her family with a better quality of life through her business.

loans.use: to purchase groceries such as soft drinks, bread,cooking oil, and canned goods to sell

loans.name: Uk

texts.en:
Uk is humble 37-year-old woman who resides in Kompong Chhnang province. She is a tradeswoman who runs a business selling beans. She buys beans from local farms and resells them at the marketplace. Uk earns an average of 3 USD a day. 

Uk is planning to start a new business raising and selling pigs for breeding and for meat. She is therefore requesting a loan from the Kiva partner HKL to purchase pigs. In the future, Uk hopes to improve her family’s living standard and secure them from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase pigs

loans.name: Ranogul

texts.ru: Раногуль  трудолюбивая женщина, она работает швеёй  в ателье. Она занимается реставрацией верхней одежды: брюк, костюмов, халатов, пальто. Раногуль самостоятельная женщина, этой деятельностью она занимается сама. Раногуль  выполняет  работу хорошо, она старается  привлечь как можно больше клиентов. Раногуль хочет расширить  бизнес, для этого ей нужно купить швейную машину. Она просит займ на сумму 1600$ США. Покупка новой машины поможет ей развить бизнес, расширить возможности. Раногуль надеется на вашу поддержку и заранее благодарит вас.
texts.en: Ranogul is a hard-working woman, who works as a seamstress at a tailor shop.  She is involved in restoring outerwear, such as pants, suits, robes and coats.  Ranogul is an independent woman and runs this business by herself.  Ranogul does her work well and tries to attract as many customers as possible.  She wants to expand her business and needs a sewing machine to achieve this goal.  She is requesting a loan in the sum of $1600.  Purchase of a new sewing machine will help her develop her business and expand possibilities.  Ranogul hopes to receive your support and thanks you in advance.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Makhliyo

texts.ru: Махлиё швея со стажем. Она начала свою предпринимательскую  деятельность  на свои сбережения в 2000 году. Махлиё  швея она занимается шитьем и реставрацией  брюк, халатов, плащей, пальто и других вещей. Махлиё не замужем, она работает  в ателье на рынке. Занимается она  предпринимательством самостоятельно. Махлиё имеет постоянных  клиентов. Махлиё  для развития деятельности  очень хочет приобрести швейную машину. Она просит займ на сумму 1600$ США. Кредит на эту сумму поможет ей в развитии бизнеса. Махлиё надеется на вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Makhliyo is a seamstress with experience.  She started her entrepreneurship with her savings in 2000.  Makhliyo is a seamstress and is involved in sewing and restoring pants, robes, raincoats, coats and other things.  She is not married and works at a tailor shop at a market.  She is involved in this business independently.  Makhliyo has many loyal customers.  She really needs to buy a sewing machine in order to develop her business. She is requesting a loan in the sum of $1600 to help her develop her business.  Makhliyo hopes to receive your support.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, eggs, snack foods, beverages and seasonings to sell

loans.name: Faida Group

texts.fr: La cliente Kahindo, leader du groupe d’affaire «Faida», est  jeune entrepreneur, âgée de 32  ans, mariée, mère de 7 enfants. Son mari est un petit commerçant. Elle est  vendeuse d’habits divers. Elle exerce ces petites activités génératrices de revenus  depuis sa jeunesse. Cependant, elle vient de réaliser 16 cycles avec  crédit de Hekima. Son premier capital de valeur de 100$ fut  reçu de son mari. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner avec  les  4 ballons friperies (de sous vêtements, soccers, essuie-mains, souliers, etc.) et réaliser d’autres micros projets de la famille.  En plus, elle souhaite  voir ses enfants grandir confortablement  et  accroitre son entreprise.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique.
texts.en:
Kahindo, age 32, is the leader of Faida Group. She's a young entrepreneur, married, and the mother of seven children. Her husband is a retailer, whereas she sells various kinds of clothing.

She's been running this kind of money-earning business since she was young. She already benefited from 16 loans from Kiva's partner, Hekima. Her first capital, valued at $100, was given to her by her husband.

This new loan will be used to buy four bales of secondhand clothing (underwear, socks, hand towels, shoes) and realize other micro project of her family.

In addition, she would like to see her children grow up comfortably and expand her business. She thanks Hekima for its action targeting poor women who are excluded from traditional banks.

loans.use: to buy four bales of secondhand clothing (underwear, socks, hand towels, shoes)

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Badral

texts.en: Badral is an 18-year-old who lives with his parents and his brother in an apartment in Ulaanbaatar city of Mongolia. His parents deliver bread and his brother has been disabled due to a factory accident. He has been delivering bread with his parents for six months. Now he wishes to drive a private taxi. He is a hardworking and diligent man who says, "Now that I am old enough, I want to support my family and to build my own life." He is requesting 1,500,000 tugriks to buy a new car.

loans.use: to buy a new car

loans.name: Robiya

texts.ru: Робия жительница города Турсунзаде. Ей 40 лет. Она замужем. У нее четверо детей. Ее муж находится в России. Сама Робия занимается растениеводством. Она выращивает овощи для продажи. Этим видом деятельности занимается пять лет. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений.
texts.en: Robiya lives in the town of Tursun-zoda.  She is 40 years old, married and has four children.  Her husband is in Russia.  Robiya is involved in agriculture.  She grows vegetables for sale.  She has been in this business for five years.  Robiya is requesting this loan for the purchase of mineral fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy 166 kg of fresh fish

loans.name: Sherwin Oliver

texts.en:
Sherwin Oliver is a hard working man who spent his whole life working hard to provide his family with amsecure and healthy living. He has been in the transportation business for two years. He owns a motorcycle transport that is used to transport students from/to school. 

Sherwin Oliver is requesting a loan amounting to P7,000 to do necessary maintenance to his motorcycle transport to keep it in the best shape and service as it should be. He will be using the loan to buy new wheels, sprockets and new chains for his transportation business. He hopes to increase the profit he generates to be able to support his children's needs and save some for his later years.

loans.use: to buy new wheels, sprockets and new chains for his transportation business.

loans.name: Ganchimeg

texts.en: Ganchimeg is 47 years-old and lives with her two sons in a house in Songinohairhan district of Ulaanbaatar, a capital of Mongolia. One son is in college and the other one is in secondary school. She started her sewing business in 2005 by renting a small space in the local market. She is has many regular customers and she is known for the quality of the service. She is a hardworking and diligent woman who says"I want to continue my business until my sons graduate a college and are able to support themselves." She is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT to purchase construction supplies to repair her house.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy wax pagnes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for a new barber kit and some barber products.

loans.name: Munhgerel

texts.en: Munhgerel is 36-years-old and lives with her parents in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in Suhbaatar Province of Mongolia. Her daughter is in kindergarten. She started her business in 2004 by renting a counter in a local market to sell clothes. She is very well experienced in her business and her current assets are 2,000,000 MNT. She has many regular customers. She is a hardworking and diligent woman who says,"I want to expand my business and one day I will open my own store." She is requesting 800,000 MNT to buy more clothes from Erlian.

loans.use: to buy more clothes from Erlian.

loans.name: Haykush

texts.en:
Haykush was born in 1962 in Ijevan City. She is married and has 3 children: two daughters and a son. Her elder daughter is married and lives separately from her parents. Haykush’s younger daughter helps her parents in business and Haykush’s son is a pupil. 

For about 9 years Haykush worked as an economist in one of Ijevan’s organizations. Then she and her husband decided to run their own business. They opened a food store in Ijevan city market. Haykush’s husband delivers merchandise from Yerevan to Ijevan city, her daughter sorts out the merchandise and puts them in storehouse, and Haykush sells them at their shop. Thanks to their family business they are able to keep their family. 

This is Haykush’s 5th loan from Nor Horizon and now she is asking for a 1.000.000 AMD loan to buy a large lot of candy, confectionery, and various tinned goods, etc., for her business.  
 
Haykush has never delayed her repayments.

loans.use: to buy a large lot of candy, confectionery, and various tinned goods, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Ahlidin

texts.ru: Ахлидин житель района Кумсангир. Ему 56 лет. Он женат. У него семеро детей. Ахлидин имеет среднее образование. Он у себя дома занимается разведением крупнорогатого скота. В основном он разводит скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Этим видом деятельности он занимается два года. Кредит берет для закупа несколько голов крупнорогатого скота и теленка.
texts.en: Ahlidin lives in the Qumsangir district.  He is 56 years old, married and has seven children.  Ahlidin has a secondary education.  He is involved in breeding cattle at home.  He primarily breeds livestock for future sale.  Ahlidin has been in this business for two years.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of several heads of cattle and a calf.

loans.use: to buy several heads of cattle and a calf

loans.name: Enhtsetseg

texts.en: Enhtsetseg is 38 years old and lives with her husband and three children in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in the Govisumber province of Mongolia.  Her children go to school and her husband works with her.  She operates a scrap metal trading business and a frozen buuz(Mongolian traditional food) sales business.  She makes the frozen buuz in her home.  She gains recognition from her clients and customers.  Enhtsetseg is a hardworking and diligent woman who says "I have a plan to expand my business by upgrading the work environment."  She is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan to purchase more scrap metal to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more scrap metal

loans.name: Munhbayar

texts.en: Munhbayar is 29 years old and lives with his wife and two kids in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in Uvs province of Mongolia.  His one daughter is a student in elementary school and the other one stays at home with her mother.  He started his taxi service in 2004 with his car.  Now he wants to buy a truck for 6,000,000 MNT.  In order to buy a truck he'll sell his car.  He'll also sell 2000 seabuckthorn trees which he planted himself, for 2,000 MNT each.  He is a hardworking and diligent man who says, "Now that the mining business is booming in Mongolia there's high demand for trucks.  With the income I want to build my own house."  He is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan to purchase a new truck for his taxi service.

loans.use: To purchase a new truck.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase more drugs to increase profit.

loans.name: Tsogtbayar

texts.en:
Tsogtbayar is 52 years old and lives with his wife and child in his wife's sister's fenced yard in Ulaanbaatar city of Mongolia. His wife stays at home and his son works at a restaurant as an assistant chef. 

Tsogtbayar studied medical practice and worked in Turkey during 2008-2010. He is a folk healer. He started his own business in 2010 when he arrived in Mongolia. He is well experienced and known for his excellent service. Due to the cold weather he needs to repair his car. He is a hardworking and diligent person who says. "With the bank loan, I want to repair my car for transportation purposes due to lack of public transportation infrastructure within my home area." He is requesting 1,500,000 MNT to repair his car.

loans.use: To repair his car to use in his folk healer's business.

loans.name: Erdenesuh

texts.en:
Erdenesuh is 42 years old and lives with his wife and two kids in an apartment in Suhbaatar province in Mongolia. His 9-year-old daughter is a student in elementary school and his 5-year-old son stays at home with his mother. 

Erdenesuh started his transportation business in 2000 using his own truck. Now he has a contract with the mining company and he is very well experienced in his business. He is a hardworking and diligent man who says, "Now that the mining industry is booming in Mongolia, my business is going very well and I have a very bright future for my business." He is requesting 3,000,000 MNT to buy new engine to replace his old truck engine.

loans.use: To buy a new engine for his truck.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more merchandise to increase profit.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more chicks and chicken feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase meat to cover customer demand.

loans.name: Ulziibaatar

texts.en:
Ulziibaatar is 48 years old and lives with his wife and three kids in a house in Suhbaatar province of Mongolia. His wife is a teacher in a public school, and his eldest son is unemployed. Two others are college students. 

Ulziibaatar operates a welding business. He started his business in 2000. Now he makes makes iron ovens, doors and large garage doors as well. He is very well experienced and well known for his skill. He is a hard-working and diligent person who says, "I need raw materials due to high demand for my products and because I am planning to buy an apartment in the near future." He is requesting 1,500,000 MNT to buy materials to make cookers.

loans.use: To buy materials to make cookers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase more food to cover client demand.

loans.name: Amiran

texts.en:
Amiran is from the village of Dzevri, West Georgia. He is 61 years old and lives with his wife Manana. Manana is retired. 

Amiran owns a small restaurant in his district. He started this business 15 years ago. Also he is involved in a family-owned agricultural business. The family owns a milk cow. Manana produces cheese, which is sold in the restaurant. Also they have 0.8 hectares of land, where maize, tangerines and vineyards are grown. Harvested products are sold locally. Total average income for the family is 400 Laris per month. 

Amiran requested credit for renovation of the restaurant. He will attract new customers due to a better, new interior. It will increase the income of the family. Amiran plans to save some funds for further expansion of the business.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for restaurant renovation.

loans.name: Mahmadi

texts.en: Mahmadi is dedicated to agriculture and the sale of cultivated vegetables. This means that he can be around his family, helping to raise their quality of life and educate all his six children. Mahmadi has been characterized as a person who is hard working, since he has been working in agriculture for seven years. This kind of work requires effort, dedication and, above all, strength; it can include heavy work, meaning that people get tired quickly. In spite of this, Mahmadi is determined to raise the level of living in his family and to improve the quality of the seeds he cultivates. For this reason, he is asking for help in order to be able to receive more credit from IMON International.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a new rickshaw.

loans.name: Habibullo

texts.en: Born in the town of Istaravshan in 1963, Habibullo lives with his wife and their eight children. Recognized by the people of his neighborhood as a serious man, Habibullo, a farmer, would like to expand his crop production so that it becomes a viable source of income. To do that, he needs a loan of $3000 USD to buy seeds and fertilizer. The income from it will then help him to cope with the needs of his large family and give all of his children a higher education. Habibullo is very grateful to everyone who can help him achieve his dreams with this loan.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph, aged 31, is married and they have two children. He has been a wheat farmer for the past seven years.

He learned about KADET through a registered client, and he has applied for his second loan from KADET LTD which he plans to use to purchase wheat seeds and fertilizers. 

He hopes to make a profit and use it to purchase sheep for fattening. He dreams of becoming a well-known farmer in the area.

loans.use: to purchase wheat seed and fertilizers.

loans.name: Rania

texts.en: Rania is a 35-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and three children who are still attending school. In 2006, and after gaining the needed experience, she opened a clothing store in her town. She sells different types of clothes designed for all ages. Today, she is requesting a loan of $3000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to expand her store’s inventory for the coming winter season. She is very positive and hoping to open a new branch of her shop in the near future.

loans.use: to expand her store’s inventory for the coming winter season

loans.name: Sharifbek

texts.en:
Sharifbek is a 36-year-old man married to a housekeeper, and they have four children. A farmer for 10 years, the biggest problem Sharifbek faces are insects that have affected his crop yield, as he lacks sufficient funds to deal with the problem. He is requesting this loan in order to purchase seeds and fertilizer.

Because agriculture is his family’s source of income, Sharifbek gives thanks to IMON and Kiva for the support it will give him through this loan. His plans include expanding his crop production so that he can support his children’s studies.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Mahmadulo

texts.ru: Махмадуло проживает в районе Кумсангир. Ему 64 года. Он женат. Махмадуло является отцом пятерых детей. Он имеет среднее образование. В центре района у него имеется магазин, где он продает продукты питания и бытовую технику. В этой области он два года. Кредит берет для приобретения электрообогревателей, радиаторов, подставки и продуктов питания.
texts.en: Mahmadulo lives in the Qumsangir district.  He is 64 years old and married.  Mahmadulo is a father of five children.  He has a secondary education.  He has a store in the district center, where he sells food products and household electronics.  He has been in this field for two years.  Mahmadulo is requesting this loan for the purchase of electric heaters, radiators, stands and food products.

loans.use: to purchase electric heaters, radiators, stands and food products

loans.name: Abdulkhanon

texts.en: Abdulkhanon is 53 years old and lives with his wife who helps him with the living expenses and their two children. For seven years, he has worked his land, which produces onions, carrots and corn. His greatest dream is to be able to establish more crops so that he can leave equal parts to his children. He started farming when his parents taught him to work in this way. Abdulkhanon is requesting financing to be able to buy supplies to apply to his crops in order to get a good yield and sell more in the market.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants.

loans.name: Soura Yé Group

texts.fr:
Mme MARIAM est la représentante du groupe SOURA YE. Elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants. Le plus âgé a 20ans et le moins âgé a 10ans. Deux(02) vont à l’école. Elle a 05 personnes en charge.

Elle est restauratrice depuis 10ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de Nabraaga en ville. Ses clients sont les femmes, homme et les enfants.

Elle veut s’acheter 02 sacs de riz, 01 carton de spaghetti et des légumes.

Mme économise pour agrandir son restaurant. Elle ambitionne ouvrir d’autres point de vente et d’assurer la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mariam is the representative of the "Soura Ye" group. She is married and the mother of four children. The oldest is 20 years old and the youngest is 10 years old. Two of her children go to school. She has five people dependent on her.

She has had a restaurant for ten years. She stocks up at the Nabraaga market in the city. Her customers are men, women and children.

She would like to buy 2 sacks of rice, 1 box of spaghetti and some vegetables.

She is saving up to expand her restaurant. Her goal is to open other points of sale and to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy 2 sacks of riz, one box of spaghetti and some vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Kifaya

texts.en: Kifaya is a 45-year-old married woman from Lebanon. She is living with her husband and three children. She has owned a bakery since 1999 where she produces delicious pastries. This will be her third Kiva loan and she notes that she has remarkably increased her productivity and income since taking the previous loans. Today, Kifaya is requesting a loan o f$2000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase baking tools and supplies. Her income is important to help support her husband and three children.

loans.use: to purchase baking tools and supplies

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein is a 57-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and three children. He has been working as a professional taxi driver since 1991. His service path is based on a wide geographical area. Despite his older age, Hussein is obliged to work hard in order to gain good income to be able to well support his family financially. And today, he is asking to borrow $1500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to perform much needed maintenance on his taxi to increase its safety. He says that he will attract more customers after making the repairs. In the future, he plans to delegate his business to his oldest son.

loans.use: to perform much needed maintenance on his taxi to increase its safety

loans.name: Hadson

texts.en:
Hadson is 53 years old, married and blessed with five children.  To earn a living, he runs a photo studio.  He has been in the business for three years.  He has employed two people to help him.  Previously, he was operating a butcher shop.  Through Faulu Kenya, he has been able to grow his business.
Hadson hopes to become financially stable in the future.  He has requested a loan of 50, 000 Kenya shillings to buy a camera.

loans.use: To buy a camera

loans.name: Hened

texts.en: Hened is a 47-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and four children, two of whom are still attending school. In 2007, she opened her own store where she started to sell home products. She also sells lingerie from her shop where she has prepared a small corner for that purpose. Today, she is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase additional home products to sell. She plans to reinforce her business operation, and her only target is to focus on one industry in order to be successful and earn satisfactory income.

loans.use: to purchase additional home products to sell

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 34 years old and a single-mother of three.  To earn a living, she sells fruits and vegetables.  She has been in the business for ten years and has employed one person.  Even though she runs her business in a very competitive environment, she is able to retain her customers because of her good reputation.  Thanks to Faulu Kenya for training her in good customer care.
Grace also does dairy farming for more income generation.  She hopes to run a wholesale business in the future.  She is asking for 40, 000 Kenya shillings to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more groceries for sale.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a farmer from the village of Bardubani, Imereti Region, West Georgia. David is 51 years old, married and lives with his family: his wife, Tea; his 12-year-old son; and his 10-year-old daughter. Both children go to school. 

David and Tea earn a living through the family agricultural business. In particular, they have a small dairy farm with two milk cows. They produce cheese and sell it on the local market. Along with the dairy, the family owns 1 hectare of land where greens and various vegetables are grown. Harvested vegetables are sold to local greengrocery retailers. Total average monthly income of the family is 550 Laris (approximately 330 USD). 

David requested credit to purchase seeds of onions and plastic for construction of a small greenhouse. He will sow the onion in the greenhouse and sell it for a high price in the winter and early spring months. It will increase the income of the family and will be used for purchasing necessary household goods to improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase plastic for greenhouse construction and onion seeds.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is a 25-year-old single man living with his parents and two siblings. In 2007, he started to work on repairing engines and scooters. He works on his own, serving customers wherever they are located. With his requested loan of $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l, he will be able to purchase more mechanical tools and supplies needed to make his repair services easier to perform. In the future, he plans to open his own garage.

loans.use: to purchase more mechanical tools and supplies

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is 34 years old, married and has five children.  

To earn a living, he makes metallic doors, gates and window frames. He has been in the business for ten years. He works hard in his business so as to provide for his family. His desire is to have a well established business within five years.

Richard has requested 100,000 KES to buy a welding machine.

loans.use: To buy a welding machine.

loans.name: Rima

texts.en:
Rima is a 45-year-old single woman from Lebanon living on her own. She has been working as a beautician since 1996. She works on a freelance basis, receiving clients at her home. 

Today, she is asking to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase an IPL machine used for hair removal. 

In the future, she is planning to open a formal beauty salon in order to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase an IPL machine used for hair removal.

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en:
Sharon is 24 years old, single and the mother of one child. She sells curios. She has been in the business for the past year. She gets a monthly income of 10,000 KES from the business.

This is her second loan from KADET. She repaid her previous loan successfully. She will use the loan amount to purchase curios for sale. 

She will use the anticipated profits to reinvest in the business. Her hope is to have a stable income so as to meet her family's needs.

loans.use: to more curios.

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine, 33 years old, is married and supports five people. He does mixed farming, rearing livestock and wheat farming. He has been doing this for the past five years.

He learned about KADET LTD, through a KADET staff. He has applied for his first loan which he plans to  buy seedlings and farm inputs

He hopes to make profit and use it to educate his children. He dreams of expanding his farming.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and farm inputs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase barber shop furniture.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is 41 years old and a single mother of one.  

She does tailoring to earn a living. She mainly makes clothes and pillow covers. She has been in the business for four years. She was previously employed before she went into business. She has retained her business because of her good customer care.

Eunice hopes to open other outlets of her business in the future. She needs 50,000 KES to buy fabric and a sewing machine.

loans.use: To buy fabric and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of charcoal.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 34 years old, married and has three children who attend school.  

She makes detergents so as to earn a living. She has been running the business for over ten years. Besides this, she also operates a cafeteria.  

Through Faulu Kenya, she has been trained in business management skills. This has helped her to improve the business.

Susan hopes to expand her business within five years. She has requested 20,000 KES to buy chemicals for making detergents.

loans.use: To buy chemicals for making detergents.

loans.name: Teresforo

texts.en:
Teresforo needs another loan to buy seedlings for planting. He has been growing tea, and with the income he earned, he has been able to pay school fees for his children.

He has challenges of limited capital to pay his workers and his dream is to own an estate.

loans.use: to buy tea seedlings for planting.

loans.name: Vasil

texts.en:
Vasil is from the village of Chognari in the Imereti region of West Georgia. He is 31 years old and lives with his family: his wife, Ketevan, his 1-year-old son, his mother and his elder brother. 

Vasil works in the village as a shoemaker. His brother is a joiner. They are the only income providers in the family. Along with their main job the family owns one hectare of land, where they grow maize, which they sell locally. The total average monthly income of the family is 700 Laris (approximately 420 USD).

Vasil constructed a new house next to his existing one, but because of scarce financing, he couldn’t construct the roof. He requested a loan for constructing the roof of the house.

As he finishes the roof, the family will have a bigger house and more comfort.

loans.use: to purchase materials to build a roof on his new house.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William has been a businessman operating a retail shop for the past fifteen years. He is 49 years old, married, and supports ten people in his family.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by the KADET staff. He has applied for his first loan, which he plans to use to purchase more stock like maize flour, wheat flour, and salt.

He hopes to make a profit and invest the income by expanding his business to a wholesale business. He is a hardworking man who can do more if funded.

loans.use: to purchase more stock like maize flour, wheat flour, and salt.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy used clothes for resale.

loans.name: Abdullah

texts.en:
Abdullah is married and has eight sons and four daughters. He is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary, and he also works in clothing sales in order to increase his income.
 
Abdullah wants to increase his sales by purchasing more clothes. The amount of money he has isn't enough to pay for the clothing, so he is taking a loan from FATEN. When Abdullah gets the loan, which will be repaid on a monthly basis, he will be able to purchase more clothes and will have a larger collection to sell. This will increase his income and help him provide better life conditions for his family.
 
Abdullah is photographed in the place where he sells clothes.


About this loan product:
 FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Bumali

texts.en: Bumali is a Ugandan male aged 43-years who needs a loan to buy maize produce for resale. The produce retail store owner hails from the Kyenjojo district and is the father of seven children aged between 24 - 8. Having had this business for 10 years, he dreams of owning a food store and acquiring a vehicle so as to ease the transportation work plus educating his children.

loans.use: to buy maize produce for resale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a focused business woman aged 40. She is married and blessed with two children who attend school. For the last three years, she has been managing a green grocer to earn a living. She also practices poultry farming for more income. In the next 5 years she wants to expand her business. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy chickens for rearing.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Musa

texts.en: Musa hails from the Kyenjojo district in Uganda. He is a Ugandan male dealing in an electrical installation and repairs business. Aged 30-years, he is the father of 4 children whom he would like to see get a good education. Being in an area that didn’t have hydro power generators which are the main source of power supply in his small town, he was able to buy one with the savings from his salon. He also helps in installing generators for other people. Musa needs a loan to purchase electrical wires for resale.

loans.use: to purchase electrical wires to resell.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is single and blessed with two children who are still in school. She has been managing a salon for the last three years to make a living. She also practices dairy farming to increase her savings. She has retained her business because of her good reputation with her customers. In the next 5 years, she wants to open other outlets of her business. With 60,000 Kenya shillings, she wants to buy hair chemicals and braids.

loans.use: to buy hair chemicals and braids.
